How did we get here?
We asked, what do people really want when it comes to healthcare?

We took our aggregate decades of medical and computer science expertise, our business acumen, and the experience we’ve gained from serving and surveying hundreds of millions of people and hundreds of thousands of doctors over the years, and came to three major conclusions:
People want a completely trustworthy source of health and wellness advice
It has to come from the most knowledgeable and trustworthy experts.
That means doctors. Nobody else will do.
When people want help with their health, they want it immediately
That means getting help when you need it—not at someone else’s convenience.
No waiting.
No excuses.
People want health
advice to be completely
personalized
Forget generalized information. You need a doctor to hear
your questions, consider your symptoms, examine your records,
for the help to be truly and utterly helpful.

both exciting
and radical
it!

We’ve introduced a ground-breaking way for you to get help from doctors swiftly, conveniently, and cost-effectively.
No more waiting rooms. No more co-pays. Just expertise from the world’s top doctors—personal, detailed, and available whenever and wherever you need it most.
We’ve also created an innovative way for you to achieve your health goals.

Ron is HealthTap's Founder and CEO. He is responsible for the company's innovation, vision, and products.

Ron founded HealthTap with the mission to improve the life expectancy of humankind by giving millions of people immediate access to health information and doctors, anytime and from anywhere. After nearly a decade helping to define the digital health industry through his pioneering work, Ron has led HealthTap’s vision of combining the power of technology with the power of good to help people everywhere live happier, healthier, and longer lives.
Ron's research on the power of smile uncovers this gem - the first use of emotions.

Ron’s commitment helping others improve their lives through health began at Stanford University where, as a graduate student, he organized and led multidisciplinary research into personalized health. This research led to the implementation of an acclaimed employee health and wellness program still used at Stanford today.
David Newman's iPad Portrait of Ron Gutman

That same passion and drive can be seen in HealthTap. Under Ron’s leadership, HealthTap has already brought together more than 100 million consumers with tens of thousands of doctors across the country, who provide trusted, high-quality, instant health information to the world, already serving more than a billion health answers to people everywhere.

With the next generation of HealthTap, Ron is working to change the lives of billions of people by providing them with instant access to doctors, together with easy ways to manage their health and wellbeing. By doing this, Ron is fulfilling HealthTap’s ultimate vision of helping people everywhere live healthier, longer, and happier lives.
TED The Untapped Power of Smiling
In addition to his passion for health and well-being,
Ron is passionate about smiling. After discovering the
transformative potential of smiling in his own life,
he began to research the benefits of smiling for the self,
others, and changing social situations for the better.
His research and learnings on the Hidden Powers of Smiling are
chronicled in a TED Talk, an article on Forbes.com and a TED book.

Our Values

Our values reflect who we are, both as individuals and as a company. We discuss these values at every team meeting and measure ourselves against them at every opportunity. They guide who we hire and how we work together. They shape the decisions we make and how we grow.
We value caring and kindness
We believe that being kind is central to living a healthy life, and having a healthy company. However we may differ in our ideas, approaches and perspectives, caring for one another unites us.
We value fun and play
We value impact

We are driven by changing the world and making a meaningful difference in the lives of millions of people everywhere. In order to achieve our goals, we are focused on driving short-term measurable milestones that add up to long-term real impact.
We value facts, data, and analysis
We believe that facts and data in context lead to better, truly personalized decisions and improved outcomes. Whenever possible, we will use facts, data, and information as the language of
our internal discussions and as the basis for our decisions. When a strong opinion and fact are in opposition, burden of proof will rest on the opinion.
We value trust, openness, and transparency

We believe that being open and transparent facilitates collaboration and teamwork and creates a constructive environment in which the best ideas flourish, regardless of their origins. We believe that openness and
transparency, together with integrity and honesty, form the foundation of trust required for our success.
We value passion and positive energy
We believe that the world is changed by passionate people who channel positive energy toward a vision they believe in. Positive energy fuels our progress and brings joy to our journey by helping us
endure, see beyond, and overcome challenges and difficulties.
We value health and
, and to help others do the same. In large and small ways, we strive to help everyone with whom we
We are on a mission to create a healthier world, and we recognize that this starts at home. We pledge to take care of our own health and
interact improve their health and
We value sense of adventure

We believe that the feeling of being on a mission will help us achieve a greater purpose with our work. As with any adventure, we will take risks and embrace failures, but always learn from our mistakes to
make us better. The path to success has its ups and downs and requires a fearless spirit. But most importantly, we recognize that the journey is as rewarding as the destination.
We value teamwork and collaboration
We believe that as a team we can achieve far more than as a group of individuals, and that the best ideas are developed through a collaborative process. We enjoy interacting with one another and
believe that our connection is central to our strength.
We value challenge and excellence
We believe that something worth doing is worth doing right. We hold ourselves to the highest standards and consistently aim to excel. We like to win, and we love to learn. We enjoy
challenging ourselves and strive for personal mastery.
We value curiosity and innovation
We believe that childlike wonder fuels creativity, and we are driven by a desire to create the new. We look for new ways of acting, and are not anchored to how things have been done in the
past. We question assumptions and the status quo, and ask tough questions that are not easily answered.
We value simplicity

We believe that simple is better, and strive to reduce complexity to its essence. We believe that with good work, any idea can be described on a napkin, and that the effort required to simplify something to its essence is worthwhile.

Why this is a big deal

Modern medicine has produced many medically proven steps to prevent and treat disease while improving length and quality of life, but most of these lifesaving interventions aren’t delivered to the right patients at the right time—primarily because patients aren’t diagnosed in a timely manner.

Modern medicine has produced many medically proven ways to prevent and treat disease while improving length and quality of life, but most of these lifesaving interventions aren’t delivered to the right patients at the right time—primarily because patients aren’t diagnosed in a timely manner.
Now, they can be.

Patients can now proactively seek scientific data about their health and receive the right care, at the right time, and at the right cost. Thanks to the care from top doctors like you and the objective data from reliable lab results, we can close these gaps in timely care and help millions of people live healthier, happier lives.

What's a delightful healthcare experience?
You get trusted medical answers when you need them
You’ll be instantly matched with a caring, U.S.-licensed, board-certified doctor qualified to treat a broad set of conditions which can be treated by Virtual Consults. No waiting. No excuses.
Unlimited empathy and boundless mutual respect
Our doctors care for you as you: a real, unique human being. You'll feel amazed by the power of the personal connections you can make with our expert physicians, who are here just for you.
Highly personalized care
Our doctor has reviewed your records, and is entirely attuned to your needs, ready to treat just you when you need it most.
Delightfully clear communication

Our doctor speaks clearly, using precise but ordinary language so you understand everything that is said. You exit the consult delighted with the clarity of the advice and information you’ve received!
True collaborative partnership
Our doctor involves you in the creation of your personalized care plan. Because you’re involved, you buy in more passionately, and will experience greater success in deploying it.
Trusted, compassionate, and courteous care

Our doctors have decades of hands-on experience, knowledge, and expertise. But they’re also so much more than that. They are kind and caring, and will patiently listen to your questions and concerns with a compassionate smile.
Your choice of type of consult
You are offered the option of a high-definition video, audio, or text message exchange with unlimited documents, photos, or video attachments.
Absolute security and privacy

uses the same 128-bit encryption and physical security that the most secure banks use. Our security practices are monitored and verified by TRUSTe and VeriSign, and supported by RSA Security. All of your Personal Health Information will be stored in a secure HIPAA-compliant environment.
Easily portable and printable digital report of your session
You get an official report for each consult that you can print or store for your records, or give to your primary care physician.

Who should participate in our Virtual Consults premium service?

Doctors who are currently best suited for HealthTap’s Prime include primary care specialists such as internists, pediatricians, emergency physicians, and family physicians. Or you could be a specialist who possesses the skills, expertise, and knowledge of a primary care physician.
HealthTap Prime Doctors:
The elite group of doctors who qualify to perform Virtual Consults
Acceptance Criteria for Virtual Consult Certification

HealthTap is at the forefront of a revolution in healthcare. Inclusion in our network of HealthTap Prime doctors rests as much on your ability to deliver a delightful virtual healthcare experience to patients as on your technical clinical skills. Participation is by invitation or application only.
Additionally, doctors:
Must be board certified by an accredited board of the American Board of Medical Specialties or American Osteopathic Association
Possess the skills, knowledge, and expertise of primary care physicians regardless of specialty or subspecialty
Have your application reviewed by the HealthTap clinical team and verified through the National Practitioner Data Bank (NPDB) and the American Medical Association (AMA) for:
Board certification status
Unrestricted license to practice medicine
Current DEA registration
No record of sanctions by licensing boards
No unusual settlements or awards in medical malpractice cases
No criminal convictions or other concerns on a background check
Pass interviews with the HealthTap staff to determine commitment to being kind, caring, and professional in a Virtual Consult

Specialities
These doctors are real people
They have the ability to make us feel well with their empathy, expertise, and embrace of cutting-edge technology.
These doctors are special
But, they are people like you and me, they have families, hobbies, interests and passions. Join us in celebrating and thanking these amazing doctors for stepping up and leading the movement.
Amazing Stories
Here are the personal stories of some of these doctors and the lives of the people they are impacting.
Dr.Kenneth Grossman

I became a doctor to help people and for the intellectual stimulation. Excelling in the sciences was a blessing, a God given talent. Helping patients is a noble way to go through life, and that fits my goals and personality!
If I wasn’t a doctor I would have been a professional athlete! I always played sports and excelled. It taught me discipline and many life lessons.
I have so many interests outside of medicine! I am a serious sports fan, outdoorsman, wine collector, and car enthusiast. I also dabble in architecture, design, and landscaping!
Dr. Lawrence Scalzo

I knew at at a young age I wanted to be a doctor. My mom was diagnosed with SLE when I was 12 years old. She was very ill and I remember being told to "wise up" because she would die soon. She is still alive and well and helps with my kids as a working mom.

If I wasn’t a doctor I would be a Master Chef. I love to help my husband on our farm. We have cattle, horses, chickens, dogs, kids and it's such a full life. I also love to cook. We hunt (me included) and raise our own meet. Nothing makes me happier than putting out food for my family.
Dr. Susan Wilturner
I consider myself to be a medical scientist, I enjoy learning and applying the safest, most sound, least toxic medical solutions to my patients.
If I wasn’t a doctor I would be a politician. A diplomat, to advocate and negotiate ethical changes.

I am an amateur dancer in my spare time! Ballet and hip hop. A ballet performer learns very early how to move, give and receive emotions from the audience. I use this in my medical profession. I am a very empathic physician and listen with my heart and try to give inspiration and butterfly kisses to the bodies and lives I touch.
Dr. Samantha Mclerran
I wanted to do something that would make a difference and have a positive impact.

I like to fix things and there is nothing so marvelous AND so complex in our world as the human body. Mankind will never know everything there is to know about the human body so when it breaks, there is always a challenge to fix it. We are often successful, but sometimes we aren’t so we must keep trying to find new answers. That's what fascinates me about healthcare.

I started my professional career as an engineer! I have a passion for baking and love to bake all kinds of breads. I've always wanted to run a bagel shop. Maybe that will be my next career! Besides medicine, I'm an ordained deacon. When I'm not working at the hospital, I'm active in my church and some of my patients get both medical and spiritual care.
Dr. Evan Prieston
I always wanted to help people. I felt it was a calling and I have been able to impact the lives of many patients.
I sing and play guitar in my spare time and I love to surf and paddleboard!
Dr. Micheal Wood
I became a doctor because of my grandfather who was a general practitioner in East Tennessee. He would take me on house calls and talk to me about why he liked to be a doctor.
I feel I am just doing what my grandfather said was important to do as a physician, "Listen, Educate and work to make mankind whole both physically and mentally.
If I wasn’t a doctor I would be a CEO/executive. I would want to be a changemaker. Someone who could have a vision to make the world a better place for people to live.

I want to be with my family every opportunity I have. I have the best wife and great children of whom I am very proud. My wife and kids are my reason to be alive and their support and God's influence in my life is what it takes to give to others.

First and foremost, be comfortable and be yourself.

We're using the words "Virtual Office hours" and "shifts" interchangeably. Both mean the time you've signed up to see your patients via HealthTap Concierge. As a Concierge doctor, you have ultimate flexibility. You can schedule shifts at the times that work best for you. The only requirement is that you make yourself available at least one hour per week. Each shift can be as short as 30 minutes, and can be scheduled in 15-minute increments. You are free to change your schedule any time.

Every consult starts with a smile and ends with a checklist.

want your personality to shine through the technology.
put your patients at ease, but will also make
them more receptive to your advice and more satisfied overall! And as always, treat
patients as you would wish to be treated--with kindness, patience, and care. We want to create
Leave the patient with a checklist.

Following up your consult with a checklist is an important way to help your patient take action towards better health. Research shows that fewer than 50 percent of patients actually follow the instructions given to them in their doctors' offices. We're striving to change that statistic. Compose a checklist of steps that your patient can follow after the consult is over. You can recommend both one-time and recurring actions. Checklists are powerful tools to help your patients change their behaviors, follow your guidance, and ultimately become happier and healthier!*
Thoroughly review your own patient records as well as the SOAP notes on HealthTap before communicating
any diagnosis or assessment to the patient.
report immediately following the consult. Always include instructions for further care in person with a doctor if symptoms persist.
(S) Subjective: Please restate the chief complaint and provide the relevant history and pertinent negative history needed to support your assessment.

(O) Objective: Document your determination of objective findings, including visible findings from your video interaction, assessment of level of stress, discomfort or severity of illness, and interpretation of any objective data given to you by the patient (verbally or via file transfer during the consult). Feel free to report data reported to you by the patient (for example, temperature, weight, blood pressure, blood sugar measurements, or peak expiratory flow readings).

(A) Assessment: Your assessment of the patient, and level of acuity should be supported by and commensurate with the subjective and objective documentation. Be as specific as possible based on the information available.
(P) Plan: Your plan must include at least one Action, plus any of these:
Actions (your recommendations for aftercare)
e-Prescription (your Rx will be sent electronically to the patient's pharmacy)
A referral (select a doctor from HealthTap's directory)
Checklists (preconfigured sets of actions to help achieve a goal)
In HealthTap's SOAP note format “plan", you may do one of three things:
Update your practice's patient records for any prescriptions issued
Certain prescriptions may not be available through the HealthTap e-prescription platform
Update your practice's patient records for any referrals made
Compose a checklist of actions your patient can take to improve his or her health
dial 911 or local emergency services while they are on the Live Consult with you. Whenever this happens, please email us
Consults concerning anyone other than your patient who initiated the consult

Assistance
Your Account Manager
Naveen Manimaran
naveen.m@healthtap.com
How do I sign up clients?

After you select your group size and price point, enter your client’s information and we will email them. You should follow-up with each client with their custom generated URL. From the email or using the custom URL your client will be able to pay and get access to their HealthTap Prime account(s).
How much does this cost my client?
You set the price for your clients. You select if you would like HealthTap to bill them monthly or yearly. There is a price floor of $15 per member per month or $100 per member per year.
How do I get paid?
HealthTap pays commissions on a quarterly basis via direct deposit.
Will I be compensated for referring other brokers?

We support general agency models such that a custom commissions structure will provide the appropriate levels of compensation for both you and your downstream brokers. Please contact your account manager if this is an option you are interested in.
What differentiates HealthTap from competitors?

HealthTap is a virtual healthcare platform that provides more than telemedicine. Other companies only offer telemedicine solutions and don’t have the doctor network or specific products and features to drive real long-term results and engagement—but HealthTap does! With HealthTap your clients will get 24/7 immediate access to primary care doctors. They also get access to over 140 specialist. Doctors on HealthTap can prescribe medication, order and review lab tests and much more. In addition, your clients also get access to the largest doctor created and curated repository of health information that is surfaced based on their health interests. Your clients can also set health goals and get timely reminders (email or push) from doctor created actionable checklists. HealthTap is here to help your clients feel healthy and happy :).
Is this an ACA-compliant coverage?

No. HealthTap is not an ACA-compliant line of coverage, but rather an ancillary solution to bridge your clients' deductible gaps. It is the perfect wrap for a CDHP skinny plan, and is proven to streamline claims utilization both in the group fully-insured space and the group self-insured space. In fact, we typically drive healthcare savings of over $50 per employee per month for these organizations.
Who pays for prescriptions and/or Quest Diagnostic lab tests?
The client’s insurance plan should cover prescriptions and lab tests. If these are not covered by the client’s insurance then these are out-of-pocket costs for the member.
Do your doctors speak other languages?

Yes. The various languages doctors speak are included in their profile. If your client is interested in speaking to a doctor in a different language, they will have to schedule a virtual appointment through HealthTap Concierge (additional cost). If the client is interested in talking to a doctor immediately, they will be connected to whichever doctor is currently available regardless of the language they speak.

Pre-purchase distribution: Licensee agrees to pre-purchase at the Base Price at least the Minimum Number of annual Qualified Subscriptions upon execution of this Agreement. Payment for this purchase shall grants Licensee the right to: (i) sell these Pre-Purchased Subscriptions at any price, for which Licensee shall receive from HealthTap all Subscription Agreement Fees collected by HealthTap for these Pre-Purchased Subscriptions.

Revenue share distribution: Licensee may pay a Revenue Share Distribution Fee, due in full upon execution of this Agreement, which shall entitle Licensee to sell memberships for the Licensee Commission set forth in Exhibit A.

HealthTap shall collect all Subscription Agreement Fees directly from End User Groups for the HealthTap Software and shall pay to Licensee: (i) the Premium Price (for the pre-purchased Qualified Subscriptions) and (ii) the Licensee Commission of the Premium Price minus the Base Price (for additional Qualified Subscriptions sold), as set forth herein.
HealthTap and Licensee agree that the terms and conditions of this agreement and any applicable addenda shall govern Licensee’s marketing and distribution of the HealthTap Software.

A través de nuestra colaboración con Quest Diagnostics los doctores pueden ordenar y revisar tus pruebas de laboratorio mediante consultas virtuales. Simplemente, visita uno de los miles de laboratorios clínicos que Quest Diagnostics tiene a escala nacional para ahorrarte varios viajes al doctor.

HealthTap doctors can prescribe medication and refill prescriptions, which you can conveniently pick up at your local pharmacy (those below and more!). By collaborating with Quest Diagnostics, our doctors can also order and review lab tests through virtual consults. Simply visit one of the thousands of local test centers nationwide to save you multiple trips to the doctor.

Doctors Choose the Best Health Apps of 2014
Annual AppRx Report

HealthTap is proud to release its first annual report on the top health and medical apps available today. Doctors on HealthTap have independently reviewed tens of thousands of health apps and provided recommendations for the best ones among the 100,000 health and wellness apps available in the iOS and Android app stores today.

By dividing apps into 30 separate categories, AppRx and the HealthTap Annual AppRx Report help users make sense of the vast landscape of health and wellness apps. The independent reviews provided by doctors on HealthTap help both patients and peer doctors learn which apps are medically sound, useful in supporting health or wellness goals, and easy to learn and use. The ratings reveal some surprising recommendations for best apps that might otherwise be missed.

This agreement (the “Agreement) is made between HealthTap Inc. (the “Company”), and the Affiliate (collectively, the “Parties”), for participation in The Company’s Affiliate Program (the “Affiliate Program”).

Affiliate wishes to promote Company’s services (“Affiliate’s Promotion”), described below (“Promoted Services”), and disseminate a customized Affiliate link provided to Affiliate by the company (“Affiliate Link”) to a landing page on the Company’s website and mobile apps (“Company Apps”) through which consumers can pay for the Promoted Services. Affiliate’s Promotion may take place through Affiliate’s website, apps, social media accounts, or other channels (“Affiliate Channels”).
In consideration of the mutual promises, covenants, warranties, and other good and valuable consideration set forth herein, the Parties agree as follows:
1. Custom Link and Promotional Materials.

a. Company shall provide Affiliate with a custom Affiliate Link directed to a specific landing page (the “Affiliate Landing Page”) on the Company’s website and/or mobile apps (the “Company Apps”). Affiliate agrees that Affiliate is only entitled to compensation, as further set forth herein, for customer sign ups generated directly from this Affiliate Link.

b. Company shall make available to affiliate, on request, certain promotional materials for display and use on the Affiliate Channels (the “Promotional Materials”). Affiliate may display the Promotional Materials on Affiliate Channels or otherwise promote the Promoted Services, provided that the manner of display and promotion are shall be subject to the terms and conditions of this Agreement and do not otherwise contradict any Company statements or terms about the Promoted Services. Affiliate shall embed a link from all Promotional Materials to Company’s Apps, as specified by Company.
2. Use of Affiliate Link and Promotional Materials.
Affiliate’s use and display of the Promotional Materials shall conform to the following terms, conditions and specifications:

a. Affiliate may not use any materials or language to promote Company’s website, apps, products or services other than the Promotional Materials, unless either: (i) Company agrees to such other materials in writing prior to their display; or (ii) such materials do not in any way misrepresent the Promoted Services or materially differ from the content on the Affiliate Landing Page.
b. Affiliate may only use the Affiliate Link and Promotional Materials for the purpose of promoting the Promoted Services and for linking to the Affiliate Landing Page on the Company Apps.
c. Affiliate will not alter, add to, subtract from, or otherwise modify the Affiliate Link and Promotional Materials as they are prepared by Company without Company’s prior written consent.
d. The Affiliate Link and Promotional Materials will be used to link only to Company’s Apps, to the link as specified by Company.
3. License.

Company hereby grants Affiliate a nonexclusive, nontransferable license (the “License”) to use the Promotional Materials and the Affiliate Links as specified under the terms and conditions of this Agreement. The term of the License shall expire upon the expiration or termination of this Agreement.
4. Intellectual Property.

Company retains all right, ownership, and interest in the Affiliate Link and Promotional Materials, and in any copyright, trademark, or other intellectual property in the Promotional Materials. Nothing in this Agreement shall be construed to grant Affiliate any rights, ownership or interest in the Affiliate Link, Promotional Materials, or in the underlying intellectual property, other than the rights to use the Promotional Materials granted under the License, as set forth in Section 3.
5. Relationship of Parties.

This Agreement shall not be construed to create any employment relationship, agency relationship, or partnership between Company and Affiliate. Affiliate shall provide services for Company as an independent contractor. Affiliate shall have no authority to bind Company into any agreement, nor shall Affiliate be considered to be an agent of Company in any respect.
6. Commissions.

a. In exchange for Affiliate’s dissemination of the Affiliate Link and display of the Promotional Materials, and for Affiliate’s compliance with and performance of the terms and conditions of this Agreement, Company shall pay to Affiliate a commission in the amount set forth below (the “Affiliate Commission”) on the terms set forth below. The Affiliate Commission is subject to change by the Company at any time and can be checked on the Company’s website at any time at the following URL: www.healthtap.com/affiliate/. Commissions will be based on the first purchases made by a new user linking to the Company Apps through the Affiliate Link.

b. Company shall keep accurate and up-to-date records of the data used to determine the total amount of Commissions owed to Affiliate. Any discrepancy between the amount of Commissions owed according to these records, and the actual amount of Commissions paid to Affiliate in any period or periods shall be rectified by Company within thirty (30) days of discovering such discrepancy.

c. Commissions are held for a period of 2 months from any purchase to protect Company in the event of any chargeback that may occur. Company shall pay all Commissions accrued and payable to Affiliate within fifteen (15) days of the first day of each month after such holdback period (the “Commission Payment Date”). Company may withhold any Commission payments as well as any actual chargeback fees for which the Company is liable that are generated through transactions from sign ups through the Affiliate Link (“Affiliate Chargeback Fees”), from any Commission Payments to Affiliate. If at any time Affiliate’s Commission Payments balance is negative as a result of Affiliate Chargeback Fees, Company may suspend or terminate the Affiliate Link or Affiliate’s participation in the Affiliate Program.

d. If on any Commission Payment Date, the amount of total Commissions accrued and payable to Affiliate is less than $25.00, then such accrued and payable balance shall be held over to the following month, and paid together with the Commissions due for that month. If at any time, the balance of accrued and payable Commissions is held over for 2 consecutive months, then Company shall pay all accrued and payable Commissions to Affiliate in the third month, regardless of the total amount owed. Payment is made via the Affiliate PayPal account or other account permitted by Company. Affiliate is responsible for any payment processing or PayPal fees associated with delivery and receipt of payment and understands and agrees that payments received will be reduced by any such fees..

e. In the event that Affiliate materially breaches this Agreement and Company terminates this Agreement within 30 days of such breach, then any accrued and payable Commissions owing to Affiliate shall be forfeited, and Company shall not be obligated to pay such Commissions to Affiliate.
f. Nothing in this agreement guarantees that Affiliate will be successful or make any money under the program. Affiliate understands that no compensation is guaranteed for any efforts made.
7. Affiliate’s Representations and Warranties.
Affiliate represents and warrants the following:
a. Affiliate has the legal authority to enter into this Agreement and to be bound to the promises, covenants, and other duties set forth in this Agreement.
b. Affiliate Channels do not contain any materials that are:
i. Sexually explicit, obscene, or pornographic;

ii. Offensive, profane, hateful, threatening, harmful, defamatory, libelous, harassing, or discriminatory (whether based on race, ethnicity, creed, religion, gender, sexual orientation, physical disability, or otherwise);
iii. Graphically violent, including any violent video game images; or
iv. Solicitous of any unlawful behavior

c. Affiliate has obtained any necessary clearances, licenses, or other permission for any intellectual property used on Affiliate Channels. Nothing on Affiliate Channels infringes upon the intellectual property rights of any person or entity. No person or entity has brought or threatened an action claiming such infringement, nor does Affiliate have any reason to believe that any person or entity will bring or threaten such a claim in the future.
d. Affiliate will not use the Promotional Materials in any manner other than those set forth in Section 2 above.
e. Affiliate will not make any claim to ownership of the Promotional Materials, or of the copyright, trademark, or other intellectual property therein.

f. Affiliate will not publish or otherwise distribute any advertising materials for Affiliate’s website that reference Company or Company’s Apps unless Company gives prior written consent to the distribution of such materials. Affiliate will not use Company’s name (or any name that is confusingly similar to Company’s name) for any purpose on or in Affiliate Channels, in Affiliate's promotional materials, or in any other context except to promote Company’s Apps as specified in this Agreement. Affiliate will not register any domain name that incorporates Company’s name, or that is confusingly similar to Company’s name.
g. Affiliate will not engage in the distribution of any unsolicited bulk emails (spam) in any way mentioning or referencing Company or Company’s website.

h. Affiliate will not attempt to create accounts to purchase the Promoted Services, sell the Promoted Services other than through the Affiliate Landing Page, promote the Promoted Services for any purpose inconsistent with the Promoted Service.
8. Indemnification.

Affiliate shall indemnify Company and hold harmless Company from any claim, damage, lawsuit, action, complaint, or other costs arising out of any breach of Affiliate’s warranties set forth in Section 7 above. Affiliate shall also indemnify and hold harmless Company for any damage, loss or other cost arising out of the use or misuse by Affiliate of the Promotional Materials.

9. Confidentiality. Any information that Affiliate is exposed to by virtue of its relationship with Company under this Agreement, which information is not available to the general public, shall be considered to be “Confidential Company Information.” Affiliate may not disclose any Confidential Company Information to any person or entity, except where compelled by law, unless Affiliate obtains prior written consent for such disclosure from Company.
10. Term.
a. This Agreement shall take effect immediately, and shall remain in full force and effect indefinitely, or until terminated pursuant to this Section 10.

b. Either Party shall have the right to terminate this Agreement at any time and for any cause. The Company may terminate this Agreement without notice. The Affiliate must give written notice to Company at least 30 days prior to the intended date of termination.
11. Taxes.

Company shall not be responsible for any taxes owed by Affiliate arising out of Affiliate’s relationship with Company as set forth in this Agreement. Company shall not withhold any taxes from the Commissions paid to Affiliate.
12. Limitation of Liability.

Company shall not be liable for any loss of profits or costs, or for any direct, indirect, special, incidental or consequential damages, including costs associated with the procurement of substitute goods or services (whether Company was or should have been aware or advised of the possibility of such damage), arising out of or associated with any loss, suspension or interruption of service, termination of this Agreement, use or misuse of the Promotional Materials, or other performance of services under this Agreement.
13. Severability.

If any part or parts of this Agreement shall be held unenforceable for any reason, the remainder of this Agreement shall continue in full force and effect. If any provision of this Agreement is deemed invalid or unenforceable by any court of competent jurisdiction, and if limiting such provision would make the provision valid, then such provision shall be deemed to be construed as so limited.
14. Headings.
The headings for section herein are for convenience only and shall not affect the meaning of the provisions of this Agreement.
15. Entire Agreement.

This Agreement constitutes the entire agreement between Company and Affiliate, and supersedes any prior understanding or representation of any kind preceding the date of this Agreement. There are no other promises, conditions, understandings or other agreements, whether oral or written, relating to the subject matter of this Agreement.

Do not use HealthTap or HealthTap Premium Services (including HealthTap Prime and HealthTap Concierge) in the event of an emergency or for emergency care. Always call 911 or your local emergency services immediately if you think you may have a medical emergency.

HealthTap and HealthTap Premium Services connect you with leading doctors, and trusted health information, all designed to help you feel good and live a happier, healthier life. HealthTap is an anonymous and freeservice, which provides free answers to health questions, health tips, and health information from tens of thousands of leading doctors.
HealthTap Premium Services are paid services, providing everything offered by HealthTap, plus virtual consults with leading U.S.-doctors, directly from your computer or mobile device.
HealthTap Basic

HealthTap and the Content on HealthTap are for educational and informational purposes only. Content posted on, created for, or compiled by HealthTap is not intended or designed to replace your doctor's independent judgment about any symptom, condition, or the appropriateness or risks of a procedure or treatment for a given person.
Content on HealthTap is not a substitute for professional medical advice, diagnosis, or treatment, and you should:

Seek the advice of a your doctor or your other qualified healthcare provider or use HealthTap Prime or HealthTap Concierge (only as appropriate and available) whenever you have a personal question about a medical condition or symptom or wherever you may need medical care
Never delay seeking this advice or disregard professional medical advice because of something that you read or see on HealthTap
HealthTap Premium Services (HealthTap Prime and HealthTap Concierge)

HealthTap Prime provides primary care virtual consults with doctors licensed in your state for limited diagnosis, care and prescriptions (as appropriate). HealthTap Concierge lets you connect with your doctor for viritual consults using the HelathTap platform, or with other doctors for second opinions or one-time consults for minor conditions that can be addressed and resolved, in the sole opinion of the doctor, via a virtual consult. HealthTap Premium Services can be a great resource between doctor visits, but are not a substitute for in person doctor visits, your primary care doctor or your primary care doctor’s independent judgment about any symptom, condition, or the appropriateness or risks of a procedure or treatment for a given person. HealthTap Prime is not health insurance and is not a substitute for health insurance.
General Additional Terms
Content posted on the Apps is the responsibility of the party posting such content, and participation on HealthTap by a party does not imply endorsement of any content, products, or services.

We do not make recommendations or endorsements. We do not recommend or endorse any specific products (including apps and devices), treatments (including medications and procedures), tests, doctors, or any Content (including opinions, or other information that may be contained or mentioned on the Apps, including user submitted Content and medical expert Content). Any recommendations or endorsements on HealthTap (including those by doctors, such as app and medication ratings, answer agrees, doctor recommendations) are not made by HealthTap. This means that the choices you make about your health are, and always will be, your own choices.

The Apps contain health-related or medical-related materials that may be sexually explicit. If you find these materials offensive, you may wish to use the Apps in ways that minimize exposure to such Content. HealthTap Medical Experts are intended third party beneficiaries with certain rights under the App Terms of Use. The Apps and the Content are provided on an "as is" basis. For additional information, see our

and HealthTap's apps.

"HealthTap" means the free service available through the Apps.
"HealthTap Prime" means the paid HealthTap Prime service available through the Apps.

"Content" means what appears on HealthTap, including what is written or reported on HealthTap, including by users or medical experts, and images/graphics or other materials that appear on or within HealthTap.

HealthTap Scholars

A HealthTap Scholar is a doctor from one of the over 128 specialties in the Medical Expert Network, chosen by their peers as a leader as evidenced by their DocScore, “Agrees” from other doctors, and network size and quality. Additionally, their high level of medical training, career accomplishments, recognized contributions to medical literature, and overall enthusiasm for HealthTap and its mission set these leaders apart from their peers and qualify them to be curators of the world’s best resource for health information online.
As a HealthTap Scholar
you hold the reigns.
Gain authority, honor, prestige, and enduring recognition as an influential Interactive and Mobile Health leader.
Hold the power to curate the best health content online
Help to educate doctors and industry leaders
Collaborate with HealthTap’s innovative MedEx Team
Control information featured on key topic pages in your specialty
Authorize Scholar invitations to other top doctors
Extend your reach to millions as an “expert among experts”
Leave your mark as a key contributor on every piece of content you review
Become a HealthTap Scholar in your specialty

Scholars are highly experienced and accomplished doctors who have earned the privilege of curating the most trusted health information on the world’s largest Interactive and Mobile Health Platform. Scholars have a passion for helping people live healthier, happier lives; they are highly educated doctors who enjoy the respect of their colleagues (as reflected in a DocScore greater than 90), are active contributors on HealthTap, and perform ongoing exceptional peer review. Admission to the Scholars program is by invitation only to the most highly qualified doctors. If you would like to be considered for an invitation, nominate yourself by sending an email to
scholars@healthtap.com.

We value your privacy. This Privacy Statement describes how we will protect and handle the personal information that you provide to us through our web, mobile and related services. Among other things, the HealthTap Privacy Statement explains:
What is this Document?
The information we request during registration
That we do not include any Personally Identifiable Information in your HealthTap Public Profile
That we do not use or share your Personally Identifiable Information, other than as described here in our Privacy Statement

To help you understand how HealthTap works, and to help you quickly find information you care about quickly, we’ve written the Privacy Statement as a series of questions and answers, and included our privacy policies in the answers to the questions.

When you sign up for HealthTap, you verify that you’ve read and agree to our Privacy Statement. Since you are agreeing to what’s contained in this document when using HealthTap, you’re encouraged to read it (if you haven't already).
Why Should I Read It?
When we say we care about your privacy, we mean it. Privacy policies are important documents, but many people don't read them because they are too long, are confusing, or are written in 'legalese.'

Because of this, we’ve designed our Privacy Statement with our members in mind, creating links to the most common questions members may have about the site and how it works where privacy issues may be involved. We’ve also written everything in plain, understandable language.

Our Privacy Statement describes exactly what information you can share with us, how that information is stored, how we use that information and what information other members can see when they use the site. Essentially, this is a master document about privacy, covering all possible bases.
page, together with suggestions about how to share securely and anonymously on HealthTap."
that describes our core beliefs about privacy and your core rights as a user of our site. These documents are located on our
In addition to this Privacy Statement, HealthTap has taken another step to share with you our commitment to privacy. We’ve created a
- Michael Nichols, Chief Privacy Officer, HealthTap
Introduction & Sharing on HealthTap

HealthTap connects users with leading doctors and other health experts, providing quality answers to health questions and related services to help you live a happier, healthier life. By helping you find relevant medical information and connecting you with the best doctors, HealthTap provides you with information to share with your doctor and support your health decisions.

Each user on HealthTap can create a Health Activity. Your Health Activity contains information that you choose to add to it. For example, you can add basic information about yourself (such as your height and weight), and personal health goals (such as losing weight), or information about health conditions you are managing (such as high blood pressure). What you add to your Health Activity is up to you. You can include as much or as little information as you like, and completing your Health Activity is not required to use HealthTap. However, the more information you include, the better and more personalized your HealthTap experience will be.
Collective Sharing
We believe that collective sharing can revolutionize the substance and delivery of personal health information. HealthTap uses your Health Activity and your stated health and wellness goals to:
Help you better understand your health
Help you better understand medical terms and conditions and what they mean for people like you
Stay more engaged with your health and well being
Track your personal health data and actions
Let you safely and securely store and manage your health data and information
Is HealthTap anonymous, safe and secure?

Yes. Your use of HealthTap is anonymous. Your real name, date of birth, email address, and other Personally Identifiable Information are not visible on the site to other members. You select a name under which you appear when using the Site (a Public Profile Name). You can stay anonymous by selecting a confidential Public Profile Name and by keeping that private. HealthTap uses bank-level security and encryption. More about our security measures can be found
How can I remain anonymous using HealthTap?
on our "Secure Sharing and Privacy" page.
stay anonymous using HealthTap

HealthTap is designed with your privacy in mind. Members are identified by a Public Profile Name that they choose and can change at any time. Safeguarding your privacy and anonymity online takes a little common sense. We've provided some tips about how to
Will I ever receive Spam from HealthTap?
about how HealthTap may use your e-mail address to contact you.
below

No. We have a strict “NO-SPAM” policy. We won’t sell any email address you enter, unless you tell us it’s OK. The email address entered when you log into HealthTap is not visible to anyone but you. We've provided more information
Back to top of page
What information is required to create an account?

To receive the benefits of HealthTap you will need to create an account. When you create an account we ask you for some basic information, such as your name, email address, and date of birth. No additional data is required to use HealthTap.
Why do you ask for my date of birth?

We ask for your date of birth because this helps us provide you with a personalized and tailored online health experience. Health conditions and the actions that may work best for you often depend on your age group. This information also verifies that you are over 16 (the current age requirement to use HealthTap). Your date of birth is not visible to others on HealthTap.

Your email address will be used to create an account. When you sign up for an account, you will also create a password. You use your email address to log into HealthTap. We will use this to send you an email requesting that you validate your account and may also use it to provide you with notices from us about your HealthTap account.
How do I change my e-mail address?

You can review and update your account information and modify, add, or delete any optional information by signing into your HealthTap account, and editing your Account Profile. You can change your email address there any time.
Is my e-mail address kept private?

Yes. Your email address is not displayed in your Public Profile, and is never visible to other members on HealthTap. For more information about how we keep your Personally Identifiable information safe and secure, see
What additional information can I provide?

You can share additional data with us as you use HealthTap to help tailor the information you see and to increase the usefulness and personalization of our service. If you choose to share personal information with us, it will be used as described in this Privacy Statement.

If you choose to use our sharing feature to send someone a Medical Expert’s answer to a question on HealthTap, we will ask you for your friend’s email address so that we can send this person an email inviting him or her to view the Content.
Will This Information Become a Part of My Health Activity?

When you share health data with us when using the site, we incorporate this into your Health Activity. You can edit or delete information from you Health Activity at any time. More information on your Health Activity, and how we keep it safe, is
What is Personally Identifiable Information, and how do you keep it private and safe?
page.
Secure Sharing and Privacy

Personally Identifiable Information is information that identifies specifically who you are. This includes information like your full name and your email address. We keep this information private by not displaying it or sharing it unless you agree. We keep this information secure, using state of the art encryption among other security measures. More information about our security can be found on our

We do not display this information on HealthTap, except inside of your Account Profile, which is visible only to you. If you choose to reveal any such information (for example, by revealing your real name and your Public Profile Name to someone, or by making yourself identifiable through your choice of Public Profile Name or image), that is your choice.
staying private while sharing securely on HealthTap

Examples of information that are not Personally Identifiable Information, and how we may use that information, are discussed in this Privacy Statement. To help you stay private and safe, we've created tips and suggestions for

We will retain your Personally Identifiable Information, like your email address, for as long as your account is active or as needed to provide you services. We will retain and use your Personally Identifiable Information as necessary to comply with our legal obligations, resolve disputes, and enforce our agreements.
What is my Health Activity and how do you keep It secure?
What is my Health Activity?

Everyone who creates an account on HealthTap can add information to their Health Activity. Your Health Activity is a collection of information that you share with HealthTap. You can see, add, modify, and remove information from your Health Activity at any time.
What kind of data might I be able to store in my Health Activity?
Personal information (such as age, height, and weight)
Basic health data (such as symptoms and conditions)
Health concerns (such as food or medical allergies)
Biometric measurements (such as lab test results)
Treatments or actions (such as medications or exercise)
Lifestyle information (such as behaviors)
You choose what information to put in your Health Activity through using HealthTap and adding information to your Health Activity.
Can I edit my Health Activity/Health Profile?

ou can edit the data in your Health Profile by changing or deleting it at any time. The changes you make are permanent. You will be asked to confirm any changes or deletions before they are made final.
Can other members see my Health Activity information?

No. Other members cannot see your Health Activity. If you enter into a Private Conversation with a Medical Expert on HealthTap (a private health conversation for a fee), your Health Activity and your real name will be visible to that expert.
Is my Health Activity secure?
Yes. Your account and Health Activity information are secure and password protected.
What is my Public Profile? What is my Public Profile Name?
Every user has a Public Profile. Your Public Profile is how you appear to other members on HealthTap.

Your Public Profile consists of your Public Profile Name and an image or avatar you choose (your Public Profile Picture). It does not contain your real name or any other Personally Identifiable Information, unless you put such information in your Public Profile Name or Public Profile Picture. Do not use your real name, picture or any other Personally Identifiable Information in your Public Profile Name and avatar if you wish to remain anonymous on HealthTap. Your real name, and other Personally Identifiable Information, are never shown in your Public Profile (unless you put it there).
Your real name is never visible to other HealthTap members. Only the Public Profile Name (i.e. your “screen name”) appears together with your Public Profile.
sharing securely on HealthTap

Public Profile Names allow you to protect your identity. Do not use your real name as your Public Profile Name. Your Public Profile Name should not reveal your identity and should be different from the names you use on other online services (for example, Twitter). You decide how to keep your information private. We’ve provided some tips and suggestions on our
You control what is displayed through your Public Profile. How you use the site and what you choose to share are entirely up to you.

If you choose to share information outside of HealthTap, this is your choice. There is always a chance that informatoin you share outside of HealthTap may be used in an attempt to identify you or may be used in ways that you or HealthTap cannot control.
Please note:
How do I close my account?
Can I close my account at any time?

Yes. You can close your account at any time by signing into your HealthTap account and choosing “Delete Account” from your Account Settings. You will receive an email confirming that your account has been deleted.
What Happens When I Close My Account?

Your account contains data that you have provided to HealthTap, including information in your Account Settings and Health Activity. After you close your account all of your Personally Identifiable Information is deleted.
Can I re-activate my account after I have closed it? Can I access my personal information after my account is closed?
No. After you close your account your account settings and all of your Personally Identifiable Information is deleted.
Can I request the removal of an unauthorized profile?
to request its removal. All such requests will be reviewed and confirmed prior to removal.
If you believe an unauthorized account has been established for you on HealthTap, please contact
What happens when I follow or connect with doctors?

HealthTap allows members to “connect with” doctors. HealthTap does not reveal your real name or any other Personally Identifiable Information to doctors when you Follow or Connect with them. If you request a Private Conversation with an expert on HealthTap, and an expert accepts this request, your name and Health Activity will be visible to that expert.
What are Messages and who can send and receive Messages through HealthTap?
What is a Message?
Every HealthTap user can start private conversations by sending direct messages to other members or to doctors. A Message is an electronic mail message..
How do I know if I have a Message?

You will be notified that you have a Message when you log into HealthTap. HealthTap will also send you an email (to the email address you use to log into HealthTap, or other email address you specify in your Account Settings) letting you know that you've received a Message on HealthTap. These notification emails do not show you what's in the message you've received. To view a Message you must sign in to HealthTap and open the message. You can turn off these notifications in your Account Settings.
Will HealthTap send me Messages?

Yes. After you sign up for HealthTap, we will send you a message welcoming you to our community and thanking you for joining us. After that, HealthTap may occasionally send messages on the HealthTap message system or to an email address you provide to us. No one likes Spam, so we do not send our members Spam. As described elsewhere in this Privacy Statement, HealthTap may also send you notifications (which you can turn off) and important messages to the email address listed in your Account Settings.
Are messages really private?

HealthTap does not read or monitor Messages. Additionally, we do not and cannot control what happens to messages once they have been sent to other members. As described below, this Privacy Statement does not apply to Message communications between members.
Does this Privacy Statement apply to Messages or external communications exchanged with other members who are not HealthTap Medical Experts?

No. HealthTap does not monitor the information exchanged in Messages. You choose what, and what not, you share in these communications. HealthTap does not control any information you provide to another user through Messages and this Privacy Statement does not apply to these communications. Additionally, the HealthTap Privacy Statement does not apply to any communications you have with other members outside of HealthTap. We encourage you to think carefully before sharing any personally identifiable information (such as an external email address or a phone number) in these communications.
Does this Privacy Statement apply to Direct Messages, Episodes or Conversations with secure communications to HealthTap Medical Experts (HealthTap’s House Call feature)?

Yes. While HealthTap does not monitor the information exchanged in Direct Messages/Private Conversations, HealthTap doctors are required to keep these communications confidential and private, much like they would for an in-person doctor-patient interaction.
How do free questions and answers work on the Site?
What are questions and answers on HealthTap?
Registered HealthTap members can submit informational questions on HealthTap and HealthTap Medical Experts can view and answer these questions. Members can thank experts for helpful answers.
Can I ask personal healthcare questions?

Questions and answers on HealthTap are for general education and information. Only general, informational questions are permitted. For specific, personal health questions, always ask your own doctor or healthcare provider. (HealthTap Medical Experts are not your personal doctor or healthcare provider, and their answers to questions are not personal or for personal use.) For a small fee, you can also ask a specific HealthTap Medical Expert a question by starting a private health conversation [Conversation].
Direct message a specific doctor to start a private health conversation. Use this functionality to communicate one-on-one with doctors in a secure environment.
Can I include Personally Identifiable Information in a question or follow up comment?

Posting Personally Identifiable Information (such as a real name, phone number, or email address) is not permitted in content that is publicly visible on HealthTap (this includes user submitted free questions or comments). Posting such information, about yourself or another person, is a violation of our Terms of Use. Do not include Personally Identifiable Information about you or anyone else in these questions, comments or any other submissions that are publicly visible. HealthTap reserves the right to remove such information from questions or comments, or to exclude such content from HealthTap altogether.
If you include Personally Identifiable Information in any publicly visible submission to HealthTap, this information may be used in ways that you or HealthTap cannot control.
How do paid questions and answers work on HealthTap ?

For a small fee, you can ask a question to a specific Medical Expert on HealthTap. The doctor has a limited period of time to respond. These questions are private (not visible on HealthTap to other members or doctors) and secure. The doctor you ask the question to will be able to see information contained within your Health Activity and can aslo see you real name.
Can I include Personally Identifiable Information in an Episode question or follow up comment?
Yes. Unlike publicly visible questions and answers on HealthTap, you can provide Personally Identifiable Information in an Episode question and follow up.
What are Public Areas of the Site?

HealthTap offers publicly accessible areas (“Public Areas”). Public Areas include, but are not limited to Questions, Answers, and information visible in your Public Profile. Any information you provide in these areas might be read, collected, and used by others who access them.
To request removal of your Personally Identifiable Information from these areas, contact us at privacy@healthtap.com.

We use personal information collected through HealthTap, including health and wellness information, to enable the services we provide, and as described in this Privacy Statement. This Privacy Statement describes the ways that we use or disclose your information. In support of these uses, we may use personal information to:
send you email and/or mobile alerts (if you opt into mobile alerts)
help you determine appropriate services relevant to you, your lifestyle and your geographic location
help you find local doctors

We may access and/or disclose your personal information, including your Personally Identifiable Information, if we believe in good faith that such action is necessary to: (a) comply with the law or legal process served on us; (b) protect and defend our rights or property (including the enforcement of our agreements); or (c) act in urgent circumstances to protect the personal safety and welfare of HealthTap members or members of the public. Personal information collected on HealthTap is currently stored and processed in the United States.
What is aggregated information and de-identified data, and how are they used?

Aggregated information is information from multiple members that is not associated with any individual user account, statistics are summaries of information, not associated with any individual user account, and de-identified data does not include Personally Identifiable Information, such as first and last names or email addresses. Aggregated information and de-identified data and statistics are used to run our service. We may use aggregated information or de-identified data gathered from HealthTap and related statistics to improve the services provided through HealthTap, and for research and analysis. We may also provide this information to our partners for such purposes.
What is a Visit Prep Sheet?

One of HealthTap’s features is a Visit Prep Sheet, which you can use f you want to share information from HealthTap with your doctor. You can view and print a summary of certain information that you provide to us, together with information that may be useful when you visit your doctor. We call this collection of information your Visit Prep Sheet. It also includes questions you may wish to ask your doctor.
Is a Visit Prep Sheet a medical record?

No, the Visit Prep Sheet is NOT a medical record, and any questions included in the sharing summary are standardized and are not a complete list of the questions that you may wish to ask your doctor. What you ask your doctor and share with your doctor is up to you. Before viewing or printing any Visit Prep Sheet sharing summary you will be reminded to use common sense if you choose to present this form to your doctor, professional healthcare provider, or use it in any other way.

HealthTap offers information to support the health decisions that you decide to make, in connection with the medical advice and guidance you receive from your doctor. The choices you make are yours. The information on HealthTap should not be used to delay or replace professional medical treatment. HealthTap does not make recommendations or endorsements. Please see our Terms of Use for more information about how to use our service.
Can I edit and delete information in My Health Activity?

Yes. You can edit or delete information in your Health Activity by signing in to your HealthTap account and editing your Health Activity. Once you edit or delete a record, you cannot retrieve it. Information in Private Conversations cannot be deleted.
Can I share information using outside social media sites?

You can share certain information from our site (such as a user question you find helpful) using sign-in services such as Facebook and Twitter Connect. Services like Facebook Connect give you the option to post information about certain activities on this Web site to your profile page to share with others within your network. We have designed HealthTap to be anonymous and you should consider the impact on anonymity of making posts using Facebook and Twitter connect.
What are email and mobile alerts?

To keep you informed of alerts relating to your questions and health and wellness goals or health actions, HealthTap may send you emails and or mobile alerts. You can opt out of receiving emails and/or mobile alerts at any time, under your Account Settings.
Is my personal information secure?

The security of your personal information is a top priority for us. We are committed to protecting the security of your personal information. Experts design our security measures and we use a variety of technologies and procedures to help protect the security of your personal information from unauthorized access, use and disclosure. For example, information transferred to HealthTap is encrypted. We restrict access to personal information to HealthTap employees, contractors, and agents who need to know that information in order to operate, develop, or improve our services. These individuals are bound by confidentiality obligations and may be subject to discipline, including termination and criminal prosecution, if they fail to meet these obligations. No method of transmission over the Internet, or method of electronic storage, is 100% secure, however. Therefore, we cannot guarantee its absolute security. More information about our security measures is located on our

We use cookies to enable you to sign in and to help personalize HealthTap. Using cookies simplifies the process of delivering relevant content and allows you to retrieve the information you previously provided, so that you can easily use the site's features. We use both session ID cookies and persistent cookies, and all browser Cookies we use are encrypted. We link the information we store in session cookies to personally identifiable information you submit while on our site. You have the ability to accept or decline cookies. Most web browsers automatically accept cookies, but you can usually modify your browser setting to decline some or all cookies if you prefer. If you choose to decline all cookies, you may not be able to use interactive features of this or other web sites that depend on cookies.

The use of cookies by any of our partners, affiliates, or service providers (such as Google Maps) are not covered by our Privacy Statement. We do not have access or control over these cookies. Our partners, affiliates, service providers may use current session ID cookies to help us improve performance and functionality of HealthTap.

Like most websites, we and our third party tracking service use log files to gather certain information automatically and store it in log files. This information includes Internet Protocol (IP) addresses, browser type, Internet Service Provider (ISP), referring/exit pages, operating system, date/time stamp, and clickstream data. We use this information, which does not identify individual members, to analyze trends, to administer the site, to track members’ movements around HealthTap and to gather demographic information about our user base as a whole.
Does this Privacy Statement apply to information from or through other separately operated products or services?

Currently, we only let you provide us with information about you (except in the case of a Caregiver providing information about a Care Recipient). This Privacy Statement applies to this information. In the future, we may allow members to provide us with information by or through other separately operated products or services.

HealthTap does not share your Personally Identifiable Information (for example, your real name or email address) with anyone unless you permit it. When you enter into a private health conversation with a doctor on HealthTap for a fee, you permit your Personally Identifiable Information to be made available to this doctor. HealthTap works by helping you find reliable and personalized health information. As part of this service, HealthTap may provide you with information about external service providers (“Service Providers”) that may be of interest or use to you (for example, a health clinic). HealthTap does not provide these external Service Providers with any Personally Identifiable Information about you, without your express consent. Service Providers cannot access your Health Activity or other health and wellness information through HealthTap.

This Privacy Statement does not apply to other service providers or links to other sites that are not owned or controlled by HealthTap, and you should read the individual privacy policies and terms of service of these providers before using their services. We encourage you to contact us if you believe a provider is not protecting the privacy or security of your health and wellness information. You may contact us in writing at: privacy@healthtap.com. We cannot provide legal advice.
What if I want to share personal information with a service provider?

Some members may want to share personal information with a Service Provider. You can always do this on your own. If we allow this in the future, before you share any information with a Service Provider through HealthTap, we will require you to confirm that you agree to any such sharing. As used in this question and answer, “Service Providers” does not include HealthTap Medical Experts.
If this Privacy Statement ever changes how will I know?

We may occasionally update this Privacy Statement. When we do, we will also revise the "last modified" date at the top of the Privacy Statement. For extremely important changes to this Privacy Statement, we will notify you either by placing a prominent notice on the home page of HealthTap or by sending you an email notification and/or a Message.
Does this Privacy Statement and any updates apply to all members?

Yes. By continuing to use HealthTap, you agree to this Privacy Statement and any updates to it. This means that if the Privacy Statement changes, you agree to these changes if you keep using HealthTap. When this policy is changed (other than for typographical corrections that do not change its meaning), we will update the "last modified" date at the top of the policy. We also will provide a summary at the bottom of the policy, describing the types of changes made.
How do you protect children’s privacy?

We are committed to protecting the privacy of children. This Site is not intended or designed for children under the age of 13. We do not collect Personally Identifiable Information from any person we actually know is a child under the age of 13.
We welcome your comments regarding this Privacy Statement, including notice if you believe that we have not adhered to it, please contact us by using this form or by email:privacy@healthtap.com.

Welcome
Responsibilities
Before you begin, you can learn more about the benefits for you, reasons to participate, and the acceptance criteria for HealthTap Prime Doctors.
Learn more ›

You do this by educating, reassuring, guiding, and when possible, treating the patient’s ailments or addressing their concerns. All aspects of the consult should be summarized in a thorough SOAP note with compassionate and clear instructions for the patient.

Typically, you will see patients who are physically located in a state in which you are licensed. However, HealthTap is a global service that helps millions worldwide. Given the demand around the world for access to top doctors such as yourself, you may be asked to take international consults occasionally. These may be from U.S. citizens who are traveling or living overseas, or from English-speaking foreign citizens who wish to ask advice of American-trained doctors. You should take these calls no matter what state you practice in. You should treat the patient just as you would if he or she were calling from within the United States, including recommending the appropriate prescription in your SOAP note.
Seeing international patients.

After centuries in which doctor-patient interactions have largely remained the same, HealthTap is revolutionizing the relationship in ways that will amaze and completely satisfy both you and your patients. In addition to your valuable technical skills and expertise, you should also call on your compassion, care, and empathy when doing Virtual Consults. As a top doctor, these are probably all second nature to you. But here’s a friendly reminder of what your patients will be expecting:
Just as you do in the real world, bring your wonderful bedside manner to your Virtual Consults!
A warm smile and greeting.
The patient will trust in your experience, expertise, and skills. In return, you should trust that your patient is being honest and straightforward.
Trust.
A key thing to remember is that the patients you see via Virtual Consults should be treated just as you would if they were right there in your office with you!
You should respect the patient as a unique, real person, and the patient will reciprocate by respecting your years of clinical experience and knowledge—and that you are a human being, too.
Mutual respect.
You’ll be ready to begin the consult without making the patient wait.
Efficiency.

Through your years of practice experience, you’ll know the relevant questions to ask the patient. Expect frequently the patient will have prepared for the consult using HealthTap, and will ask very informed questions.
Intelligent questions.
The patient should be able to easily understand what you say.
Clear communication.
Most patients will expect to collaborate with you in the creation of their care plan. Encourage this, as it will increase their buy-in.
Partnership.
The patient will expect empathy from you in a relationship that is warm yet stays in the professional realm.
A personal connection with appropriate boundaries.
