computer:
desktop or laptop
To prepare for Virtual Consults on your
Launch HealthTap.com in your Chrome, Firefox, or Safari browser. To ensure an optimal videoconferencing experience, avoid using Internet Explorer due to its inferior video conferencing support.
Make sure your computer is connected to a high-speed (0.25Mbps or better) and reliable wired or wireless internet connection (DSL, cable modem, or better). To verify this, you can conduct a
speed test of your connection.
Make sure your microphone and webcam are connected and working. You can
test your webcam and microphone for free.
mobile device

(0.25Mbps or better). We strongly advise against taking video calls on 2G, 3G, or other mobile data connections. They tend to lack sufficient bandwidth to stream videos in high quality. Mobile 4G and LTE connections are often sufficient, but these video consults will use data that count towards your monthly data plan.
Make sure you are connected to a strong, reliable, high-speed wifi network
Launch HealthTap For Doctors on your iPhone, iPad or Android tablet or smartphone, and log in to your doctor account for the duration of your shift.
Preparing Your Environment

You have the ultimate flexibility on where you accept patient calls. That being said, we recommend taking Virtual Consults from your desktop or laptop computer, using a reliable, high-speed internet connection, in your home or office, with the door closed. Here are some helpful tips to keep in mind when you choose a venue for your Virtual Consults:
Maintain an organized workspace.

Just like in your real practice, the presentation of your office can create a strong sense of professionalism and trustworthiness for your patients. Try to do the same with any environment that you choose for your Virtual Consults.
Give the patient your undivided attention.

Given the flexibility to work from places other than your office behind closed doors, it may be tempting to multitask. During a Live Consult, please create an environment where distractions will be minimized.
Keep it confidential.

As with any patient visit, ensure that nobody can hear your confidential conversations. Please also make sure that no one can see the patient on your screen or have access to any personal health information. If you do have to step away for a minute, we recommend locking your computer with a password.
Avoid interruptions and noise.

Whatever venue you choose, you’ll naturally want to make sure it is private. An ideal space is a quiet room with a door to close and lock so you can avoid interruptions. Microphones can sometimes pick up subtle background noises, so please be mindful of minimizing these.
Arrange proper lighting.

Make sure your room or environment is well lit and your face is properly illuminated for your video camera. Avoid sitting against a lit background (for example, an open window, a lamp, or a sunny sky) as this typically darkens your face and negatively impacts visibility for the patient.
Attain appropriate attire and grooming.

First and foremost, be comfortable and be yourself. Even though you may sometimes take Virtual Consults from the comfort of your home or while away from work, always remember to dress professionally, as you would when seeing patients in your physical office. Wearing a white coat may also help lend credibility to the video consult. Finally, bright or vividly patterned shirts may be distracting for the patient over video.
Shift Sign Up
You can sign up for three different types of shifts on HealthTap or see patients during ad-hoc availability:
Committed
On Standby

You are on call to cover a doctor in the event of a shift cancellation or high patient demand. If notified, you should sign in to your shift within 30 minutes of notice and see patients for the duration of the shift. You will be paid per consult. Doctors who cover shifts from On Standby are routed patients before Try Me doctors.
Try Me

You volunteer to take consults during this shift without guaranteeing your availability. You will be paid per consult, and routed overflow patients that cannot be seen by a Committed or On Standby doctor at the time.
Ad-Hoc Availability

As a HealthTap Prime doctor, you do not have to sign up for shifts. You have the ultimate flexibility to also check in or check out of being “Available” to take consults from patients in the queue. However, doctors on shift will get preference in accepting these consults over doctors who are available Ad-Hoc.
Here’s what you’ll earn by conducting Virtual Consults:
* Guaranteed minimum compensation is available to physicians who (i) enroll in Committed shifts; and (ii) meet HealthTap eligibility requirements, which are subject to change by HealthTap.

, so we are able to offer our Prime doctors a great deal of flexibility. Or you can choose the On Standby or Try Me shifts for even greater flexibility. Once you’ve committed to a shift, here are the three ways you can change or update your schedule:
We operate 24/7/365
You can choose whichever shifts fit into your schedule.
: You can make a permanent change to your schedule at any time one month or more in advance.
Permanent Shift Updates
You can make a request for time off more than one week in advance.
Individual shift cancellations:

These changes are made less than one week in advance. Changes on short notice are excusable only for real personal and professional emergencies. Requests to change shifts without an acceptable excuse may result in your loss of privileges as a HealthTap Prime doctor.
Emergency shift updates:

Since we are a 24/7/365 service, we expect our doctors to fulfill their shifts on federal holidays. If, for any reason, you will not be available for your shift, please notify us of this with at least one-week notice.

Protocol for a successful consult
For Each Consult

Patients love the human connection and want your personality to shine through. Studies show that a smile will not only help put your patients at ease, but will make them more receptive to your advice and be more satisfied overall! And as always, treat patients as you would wish to be treated--with kindness, patience, and care. We want to create a delightful doctor-patient experience during each and every Virtual Consult.*

The following are examples of objective observations you can make over a Live Consult:
BP: recently measured at home or the pharmacy
Extremity appearance: (relating to cellulitis [strep], gout, inflammation): swelling [edema], and red streaking of the skin
A critical aspect of HealthTap’s SOAP note format is the “plan,” or course of treatment. In this section, you may do one of three things:
Issue an e-prescription transmitted to the patient’s local pharmacy.
Whenever possible, prescribe the generic version of a drug over its brand name version
Summary (e.g., “Drink more water,” “Avoid eating before sleeping,” etc.)
to ensure that patients requesting consults minutes before shift ends are still helped. Please try not to rush consults even if they extend beyond a few minutes over the end of your shift.

For Each Shift

To start your shift, log onto HealthTap (desktop or laptop) with your browser open and / or have the HealthTap For Doctors app installed on your iPhone, iPad, or Android smartphone, or Android tablet device and click “Start Shift” in the app. This will check you in to your shift.

Millions of people come to HealthTap, eagerly and anxiously awaiting advice from top doctors like you. Please treat patients on a first-come-first-served basis and answer calls immediately during your allocated time slot.
If you need to take a bathroom break or step away from your computer, you should hit the “Take 5” button, which marks you as unavailable for five minutes. You may do this once an hour.
Between Live Consults
Between Live Consults, you are responsible for responding to all Inbox Consults that appear in your queue on a first-come, first-served basis.
Inbox Consults.

HealthTap believes in providing only the highest levels of quality care by only the best doctors. If you have no Live Consults or Inbox Consults pending, you are responsible for helping us conduct peer review on the SOAP notes of your colleagues to provide an evaluation of others’ documentation for the purpose of quality assurance. For each consult peer review request, you will be asked to answer the following multiple choice question and to briefly explain your responses:
Peer Review for Quality Assurance.
Please indicate your evaluation of the documentation of this consultation:

Millions of HealthTap members seek your expertise on thousands of health topics every day. Fill any downtime by answering questions, creating tips or checklists, reviewing news articles, and peer reviewing your colleagues’ answers to help others live happier healthier lives, enhance your reputation, and continue your lifelong pursuit of learning!
Answer questions and more.
Between Shifts
Please be highly responsive to pharmacists to ensure a great experience for your patients.
Reasons for Disciplinary Action
In the extremely unlikely scenario that any of these events occur, we would be required to take disciplinary action which could include loss of privileges for HealthTap Prime and Virtual Consults:
Unexcused absence from a time slot you have committed to
Not providing sufficient notice (one week) of being unable to work a single time slot to which you’ve committed
Not providing sufficient notice (two weeks) of changing your on-going shift schedule
Lack of professionalism in consulting with patients
Loss of DEA license
Loss of hospital privileges for cause
Delivering a lower standard of patient care than is considered acceptable by the HealthTap Quality Care Committee
Loss or suspension of state license
Loss of board certification
Sanction or reprimand by a state regulatory board (case-by-case review)
Conviction of a felony
HealthTap business reasons

“With a newborn child, it’s hard to do anything or go anywhere such as the medical centre. This app save me the time it would take to go to the doctor when it's not necessary. — Andrea W., new mom

“My son who's now 12 years old was born with several congenital issues. After several surgeries over the years, he's now a healthy child of 12 years. If I need any help or any tips, I find it on HealthTap, not only for him also for the whole family! It really helps!“
— Kristen J., mother of two

“I wish I had HealthTap Prime when my mom had a stroke and was in a coma. It would've been amazing to get an immediate second opinion instead of paying $1000 out of pocket. Now, I can use HealthTap in minutes for a virtual consult.“
— Lisa S., NYC

At HealthTap, we decided:
doctor-patient experience.
Let’s redefine the
Our Virtual Consult premium service is the result
Imagine a world in which you do what you enjoy and you're best at — practicing medicine — but without the overhead of office rent, equipment purchases, staff, and other practice expenses.
Pick the practice hours that suit you best. Are you a morning person? Do you work best after midnight? HealthTap can accommodate you!
Choose the location in which you are most productive. Your home. Your office. Your vacation home. Any place with an internet connection will do. Yes, even from your mobile device.
Join the revolution in healthcare while rediscovering the joy of practicing medicine!

You’ll be well compensated for flexible short or long shifts or ad-hoc availability. You could make up to $500,000 a year using a simple mobile device from anywhere with an internet connection. And you get paid quickly—no struggling with reimbursements.
Forget the commute
No more fighting traffic or living in a high-cost part of the country. You can live wherever you want and still make a great living doing what you love!
Choose flexible hours
Enjoy the practice of medicine at times that are the most convenient for you!
Take advantage of the latest and greatest technology

Our cutting-edge apps are acclaimed for their ease of use and designed specifically for doctors by the most innovative artisans and inventors in Silicon Valley. Everything is paperless, stored in the cloud, private, and HIPAA-secure.

Doctors who are currently best suited for HealthTap Prime include primary care specialists such as internists, pediatricians, emergency physicians, and family physicians. Or you could be a specialist who possesses the skills, expertise, and knowledge of a primary care physician.

Do not use HealthTap or HealthTap Prime in the event of an emergency or for emergency care. Always call 911 or your local emergency services immediately if you think you may have a medical emergency.

HealthTap and HealthTap Prime connect you with leading doctors, and trusted health information, all designed to help you feel good and live a happier, healthier life. HealthTap is an anonymous and free service, which provides free answers to health questions, health tips, and health information from tens of thousands of leading doctors.
HealthTap Prime is a paid service, providing everything offered by HealthTap, plus virtual consults with leading U.S.-doctors, directly from your computer or mobile device.

Seek the advice of a your doctor or your other qualified healthcare provider or use HealthTap Prime (as appropriate and available) whenever you have a personal question about a medical condition or symptom

HealthTap Prime provides virtual consults where you can connect with a doctor licensed in your state for limited diagnosis, care and prescriptions (as appropriate). HealthTap Prime can be a great resource between doctor visits, but is not a substitute for your primary care doctor or your primary care doctor’s independent judgment about any symptom, condition, or the appropriateness or risks of a procedure or treatment for a given person. HealthTap Prime is not health insurance and is not a substitute for health insurance.

What We Do and What We Don’t Do
We Do Support Your Health Decisions and Choices

These decisions and choices are yours, and we believe that you, in connection with the advice you receive from your doctor or other professional healthcare provider, are the best decision maker about your health. You should always use common sense when making health decisions, and they should be made in consultation with your doctor. HealthTap cannot make decisions for you. What we can do is help you find good health information and connect with doctors for in-person care. On HealthTap you can ask and find informational questions and related educational answers and tips by Medical Experts. HealthTap is not a place for the practice of medicine, but Medical Experts on HealthTap can be a resource for reliable, relevant general health information. We hope these services will be of value to you. Please use them responsibly.
No Doctor Patient Relationship

HealthTap contains Content, and may help you identify services or may offer services. Everything on HealthTap, including Content accessed or Services provided through HealthTap, are for your information, and should be used for informational purposes only. This means that Content and Services are not a substitute for medical advice, diagnosis, treatment, or care from your doctor.
The use of HealthTap does not create a doctor-patient relationship.

Whenever we use the words "your doctor" or "your doctor" or "healthcare provider" or similar words on HealthTap, including in these Terms of Use, we mean your personal doctor with whom you have of an actual, mutually acknowledged, doctor-patient relationship (or the same kind of formal, real-world relationship between you and your personal professional healthcare provider) within the United States. HEALTHTAP MEDICAL EXPERTS ARE NOT "YOUR" DOCTOR OR HEALTHCARE PROVIDER. Even if your real life doctor is on HealthTap, personal medical advice, treatment or diagnosis are not permitted through HealthTap, and by using HealthTap you agree not to solicit these or use any information as if it were personal advice, treatment, or diagnosis. This applies both to public interactions on HealthTap as well as to Private Conversations. Whenever you want personal medical advice, treatment, or diagnosis, you should contact your doctor or professional healthcare provider and see them in person.

On HealthTap you can connect privately with a doctor for an online consultation through our Private Conversation feature. This interaction does not constitute the practice of medicine and consultations cannot be used for providing a medical diagnosis or a physical examination, prescriptions, or treatments. Go see your doctor in person if you are looking for a prescription, or for diagnosis or treatment. You can use HealthTap for second opinions.
Do not use HealthTap in a medical emergency, or for diagnosis or treatment.
Do not use HealthTap or Content or Services to diagnose or treat a medical condition. Do not use HealthTap or Content or Services in a potential or actual medical emergency.
Consult your doctor.

Consult your doctor or your healthcare provider if you have any questions about a symptom or a medical condition, and before starting or stopping any treatment directed by your doctor or your healthcare provider, or before taking any drug or changing your diet.
ALWAYS:
NEVER DISREGARD PROFESSIONAL MEDICAL ADVICE, OR DELAY SEEKING MEDICAL ADVICE OR TREATMENT BECAUSE OF SOMETHING YOU READ OR LEARN ON HEALTHTAP.
IMMEDIATELY CALL 911 OR YOUR DOCTOR OR GO TO THE HOSPITAL IF YOU BELIEVE YOU HAVE A MEDICAL EMERGENCY.

We have rules for submitting questions or posting Content on HealthTap. A few things you should know:
Only informational questions submitted for educational purposes are allowed
No personal health questions are permitted – you are not allowed to provide facts that give questions the impression of being patient-specific
Questions can describe a general situation, illustration, illness, or symptoms, but the question should withhold enough facts so that it’s clear that it’s not describing an actual, specific patient
There is no guarantee that any submitted question will be answered
Questions are answered at the sole discretion of doctors participating in the our community as Medical Experts
No follow up questions or personal information should be included in Thanks notes submitted through HealthTap
When accessing our Premium Content and Services, including private conversations with Medical Experts you should know the following:
No requests for prescription, diagnosis or treatment should be made
Any second opinions received are not diagnosis, prescription, or treatment and are for informational purposes only

When you enter into a Private Conversation with a HealthTap Medical Expert, that person will be able to see personally identifiable information about you– including your name and the content in your Health Activity.

There is no guarantee that any submitted question, follow up question or comment, or request for a Private Conversation will be answered– if a question is not answered within a set period of time, a refund will be provided
Questions are answered at the sole discretion of doctors participating in the HealthTap community as Medical Experts

Medical Experts: Permission to Post and Use Expert Submissions.
So that everyone can enjoy HealthTap, we have rules for Content in Public Areas. A few things you should know:
Medical Experts:Rules when Submitting Expert Content.
Edit student and assistant answers before verifying them if you believe that you can improve the educational and informational quality of the answers.

Verify student and assistant answers only when you reasonably believe that they are likely to be useful and helpful to HealthTap members and when they meet the same standards you would apply to your own answers.

HealthTap answers should be relevant content that is educational and informational. Answers can provide general guidance, context, and illustration. You are welcome to refer to general medical conditions, symptoms and treatments, but please do not diagnose any individual member or prescribe any specific treatment in your answers. Individualized or diagnostic answers are not allowed and prescribing medications is not allowed. Answers should not provide specific treatment recommendations or give the impression that they are a substitute for a real-life consultation with a doctor. YOU ARE NOT PERMITTED TO PRACTICE MEDICINE ON OR THROUGH HEALTHTAP, EVEN IF YOU ARE INTERACTING WITH AN ACTUAL PATIENT OF YOURS. ALL MEDICAL DIAGNOSIS, TREATMENT, PRESCRIPTION AND ACTUAL CARE MUST OCCUR OFF HEALTHTAP, REGARDLESS OF ANY EXISTING RELATIONSHIP BETWEEN THE PARTIES.
Avoid Practicing Medicine.

Feel free to interact professionally with members and create long-lasting relationships with those in your community. However, help us keep the personal information of our members confidential. Please don’t refer to members in or on Content in Public Areas by their real names, even if this information has been disclosed to you.
Avoid Revealing Private Information.

Responses should always be appropriate. Brief, casual, and friendly responses are the most useful. Help HealthTap remain a trusted resource, by avoiding potentially offensive content whenever possible.
Avoid Offending Others.

Feel Free to share your professional clinical expertise though answers that are evidence-based and consistent with accepted standards in the medical community. HealthTap is for general questions. Refrain from using language that suggests an answer is provided for a single member. Unless you are in a Private Conversation with a user on HealthTap, refrain from answering questions that solicit your individual opinion as a single Medical Expert. Avoid answering questions or providing answers that suggest a duty of care and a doctor-patient relationship.
Avoid Communications that Suggest a Physician-Patient Relationship.

You are allowed to link to external websites that are both appropriate and related to your responses, but answers on HealthTap should be complete and should not be used for primarily promotional purposes. Please do not plagiarize and cite sources where applicable. Using answers as a vehicle to promote a product or service is prohibited. Providing members with useful and beneficial information and attracting new patients through useful Content is permitted, but mere schilling is not.
Avoid Commercial Responses.

Patients on HealthTap can find your professional contact information through your Virtual Practice, and can contact you for an appointment. However, please avoid violating medical board rules regarding advertising and patient solicitation.
Avoid Advertising or Specifically Soliciting Patients.

Be careful not to discuss privileged or confidential details of past or current patients, or accidentally revealing confidential information in an indirect way – such as by discussing hypothetical illustrations that could be traced back to specific patients.
Avoid Disclosing Confidential Material.
Avoid other actions that violate board or other rules that apply to you.
Avoid Violating Board Rules.

5. Fees, Payment and Taxes.
6. Intellectual Property and Content Rights.

HealthTap shall retain all right, title and interest in the HealthTap Intellectual Property and Proprietary Material. Subscriber hereby transfers and assigns and agrees to execute any documents required to transfer and assign to HealthTap all rights, title and interest in the HealthTap Intellectual Property and Proprietary Material and related protectable elements or derivative works.
A. Ownership of Intellectual Property.

As between HealthTap and Subscriber, HealthTap and/or Participant own all rights, title and interest in and to all content (including electronic data or information) submitted by any Participant to HealthTap in connection with a Private Conversation, and such submissions are considered Confidential Information under this Agreement and are subject to the HealthTap Terms of Use and Privacy Statement. Subscriber Content, including content uploaded to HealthTap, is subject to HealthTap’s Terms of Use and Privacy Statement. Subscriber agrees not to upload or transmit any Content that (i) infringes another’s rights, (ii) is confidential, (iii) contains offensive content (including hate-speech, obscenity, and pornography), or any material that could give rise to any civil or criminal liability under applicable law or regulations, or (iv) contains software viruses or any other computer code, files or programs designed to interrupt, destroy or limit the functionality of any computer software or HealthTap.
B. Participant Content and Subscriber Content.
7. Restrictions.

Confidential information disclosed by HealthTap to Subscriber shall not be disclosed or used by Subscriber for any purpose outside the scope of this Agreement, except with HealthTap’s prior written permission, and Subscriber shall protect the Confidential Information as it would its own.
A. Confidential information

Subscriber shall use HealthTap solely as contemplated by this Agreement and shall not: (i) license, sublicense, sell, resell, rent, lease, transfer, assign, distribute, time share or otherwise commercially exploit or make HealthTap available to any third party, except as otherwise contemplated by this Agreement; (ii) send duplicative or unsolicited messages in violation of applicable laws; (iii) send or store infringing, obscene, threatening, libelous, or otherwise unlawful or tortuous material, including material that is harmful to children or violates third party privacy rights; (iv) send or store Malicious Code on or through HealthTap; (v) interfere with or disrupt the integrity or performance of HealthTap or the data contained therein; or (vi) attempt to gain unauthorized access to HealthTap or its related systems or networks.
B. Limited Use.

Without the prior consent of HealthTap, during the Term of this Agreement and for a period of one (1) year following the termination of this Agreement, Subscriber shall not, directly or indirectly: (A) for Subscriber or on behalf or in conjunction with others, develop or serve as the primary owner of any business which is in competition with HealthTap or (B) enter into any other agreement or other arrangement (written or oral) with a party other than HealthTap or its affiliates to license services or provide Private Conversations similar to those described in this Agreement; provided, however, these restrictions shall not prohibit Subscriber from practicing medicine or performing services for Subscriber’s employer or otherwise that are disclosed in writing to HealthTap prior to the Effective Date.
C. Exclusivity.

In the event of an actual or threatened breach of the provisions of this Article 6, HealthTap and affiliated entities, in addition to any other remedies available to them shall be entitled to injunctive relief restraining Subscriber from such conduct.
D. Breach.

A. Term.

Either party may terminate this Agreement without cause upon thirty (30) days written notice; upon such termination by Subscriber, Subscriber agrees not to participate in any further Private Conversations on HealthTap and any such participation shall reinstate this agreement; upon such termination by HealthTap, Subscriber agrees not to participate in any further Private Conversations on HealthTap. This Agreement may be terminated with cause (i) upon thirty (30) days written notice by non-breaching party of a material breach to the breaching party if such breach remains uncured at the expiration of such period; (ii) immediately, if a party becomes the subject of a petition in bankruptcy or any other proceeding relating to insolvency, receivership, liquidation or assignment for the benefit of creditors, (iii) immediately, upon notice by HealthTap upon a breach of any of Sections 3, 4 or 7(D).
B. Termination.

The parties shall cooperate in complying with all federal, state, and local laws and regulations applicable to the HealthTap Services and related arrangements, including, without limitation, the Business Associate requirements of the Health Insurance Portability and Accountability Act of 1996 ("HIPAA") (45 C.F.R. parts 142 and 160-164, as may be amended), any other applicable laws and regulations governing the security and privacy of electronically stored health care and financial information, and, as such, each of the parties agree to the terms of the HIPAA Business Associate Addendum provided by HealthTap to Subscriber
10. Legal Compliance.
11. No Warranties, Mutual Indemnification and Limitations of Liability.

EXCEPT AS EXPRESSLY PROVIDED HEREIN, NEITHER PARTY MAKES ANY WARRANTIES OF ANY KIND, WHETHER EXPRESS, IMPLIED, STATUTORY OR OTHERWISE, AND SPECIFICALLY DISCLAIMS ALL IMPLIED WARRANTIES, INCLUDING ANY WARRANTIES OF MERCHANTABILITY OR FITNESS FOR A PARTICULAR PURPOSE, TO THE MAXIMUM EXTENT PERMITTED BY APPLICABLE LAW.
A. No Warranties.

IN NO EVENT SHALL HEALTHTAP’S AGGREGATE LIABILITY ARISING OUT OF OR RELATED TO THIS AGREEMENT, WHETHER IN CONTRACT, TORT OR UNDER ANY OTHER THEORY OF LIABILITY, EXCEED THE LESSER OF $100 OR THE AMOUNTS ACTUALLY PAID BY AND DUE FROM SUBSCRIBER HEREUNDER IN THE ONE MONTH PRECEDING THE INCIDENT GIVING RISE TO LIABILITY. IN NO EVENT SHALL EITHER PARTY HAVE ANY LIABILITY TO THE OTHER PARTY FOR ANY LOST PROFITS OR FOR ANY INDIRECT, SPECIAL, INCIDENTAL, PUNITIVE, OR CONSEQUENTIAL DAMAGES HOWEVER CAUSED AND, WHETHER IN CONTRACT, TORT OR UNDER ANY OTHER THEORY OF LIABILITY, WHETHER OR NOT THE PARTY HAS BEEN ADVISED OF THE POSSIBILITY OF SUCH DAMAGES.
B. Limitations of Liability and Damages.

Subject to this Agreement, HealthTap shall defend, indemnify and hold Subscriber harmless against any loss, damage or costs (including reasonable attorneys’ fees) incurred in connection with claims, demands, suits, or proceedings ("Claims") made or brought against Subscriber by a third party alleging that the use of the HealthTap Services or a HealthTap Mark as contemplated hereunder infringes the intellectual property rights of a third party; provided, that Subscriber (a) promptly gives written notice of the Claim to HealthTap; (b) gives HealthTap sole control of the defense and settlement of the Claim; and (c) provides to HealthTap, at HealthTap’s cost, all reasonable assistance. Subject to this Agreement, Subscriber shall defend, indemnify and hold HealthTap harmless against any loss, damage or costs (including reasonable attorneys’ fees) incurred in connection with Claims made or brought against HealthTap by a third party alleging (i) the proximate and direct cause of the event giving rise to a claim for indemnification is Subscriber’s negligence in connection with a Private Conversation or follow up related to the same, (ii) fraud or misrepresentation in Subscriber’s information included in the Profile, (iii) Subscriber’s violation of legal rules or requirements in the conduct of the Private Conversations, (iv) Subscriber’s infringement of certain intellectual property rights in the use of the Content, or (v) that the where the proximate and direct cause of the event giving rise to a claim for indemnification relates to a services or action by Subscriber outside of Subscriber’s use of HealthTap or HealthTap Services; provided, that HealthTap (a) gives written notice of the Claim to Subscriber; (b) gives Subscriber sole control of the defense and settlement of the Claim; and (c) provides to Subscriber, at Subscriber’s cost, all reasonable assistance.
C. Mutual Indemnification.
12. General Provisions.

Each party represents and warrants that it has the legal power to enter into this Agreement. This Agreement does not create a partnership, joint venture, agency, fiduciary or employment relationship between the parties. This Agreement is the entire agreement between Subject and HealthTap relating to its subject matter, and replaces any prior agreements concerning its subject matter. If there is any conflict between this agreement and a mutually signed written agreement between HealthTap and Subscriber related to HealthTap, the signed written agreement will control. If HealthTap provides a translation of the English language version of this agreement, the English language version of this agreement will control if there is any conflict. If HealthTap chooses not to enforce any provision of this Agreement, HealthTap retains the right to enforce it in the future. This means that the failure to enforce any provision of this Agreement does not constitute a waiver of that provision. If any provision in this Agreement is found to be unenforceable, it and any related provisions will be interpreted to best accomplish the essential purpose of any unenforceable provision. Neither party may assign any of its rights or obligations hereunder without the prior written consent of the other party (not to be unreasonably withheld); provided, however, HealthTap may assign this Agreement without consent of Subscriber, in connection with a merger, acquisition, corporate reorganization, or sale of all or substantially all of its assets. Any attempt by a party to assign its rights or obligations under this Agreement in breach of this section shall be void. Subject to the foregoing, this Agreement shall bind and inure to the benefit successors and permitted assigns. This agreement is governed by California law, excluding California's choice-of-law rules. THE EXCLUSIVE VENUE FOR ANY DISPUTE RELATING TO THIS AGREEMENT IS SANTA CLARA COUNTY, CALIFORNIA. YOU AND US CONSENT TO THE PERSONAL JURISDICTION OF THESE COURTS. Nothing in this agreement limits either party's ability to seek equitable relief. All notices under this Agreement shall be in writing and shall be deemed to have been given upon: (i) personal delivery; (ii) the second business day after mailing; (iii) the second business day after sending by confirmed facsimile; or (iv) if by HealthTap to Subscriber, the second business day after sending by email. Notices shall be directed to the party’s current known address, and if by email to HealthTap, to: notice@healthtap.com.

The License and Subscription Fee shall be the License and Subscription Fee Percentage. The License and Subscription Fee Percentage is a percentage of the Conversation Fee that ranges between Twenty and Twenty-Five Percent of the Conversation Fee based on the DocScore of the Subscriber. Each separate transaction in a Private Conversation, such as a question and a follow up question, shall each be subject to a Conversation Fee.

The Parties desire to protect the individual privacy and provide for the security and confidentiality of the PHI and ePHI disclosed to HealthTap by Subscriber or generated or transferred by HealthTap on behalf of Subscriber in accordance with HIPAA and HIPAA Regulations and the HITECH ACT, the Health Insurance Portability and Accountability Act of 1996 (Public Law 104-191) ("
B.

As part of the HIPAA Regulations, Subscriber is required to obtain "satisfactory assurances" from HealthTap that it will appropriately handle and safeguard any PHI disclosed to it by Subscriber or generated by it on behalf of Subscriber and that HealthTap will implement safeguards that "reasonably and appropriately" protect the confidentiality, integrity, and availability of any ePHI that it creates, receives, maintains, or transmits on behalf of Subscriber. Accordingly, the Parties enter into this Addendum governing HealthTap’s use and disclosure of PHI and HealthTap’s implementation of safeguards to reasonably and appropriately protect the confidentiality, integrity, and availability of ePHI.
In consideration of the mutual promises below and the exchange of information pursuant to this Exhibit, the Parties agree as follows
As used herein the following terms shall have the following definitions:
"Business Associate" shall mean HealthTap.
Business Associate.
"Covered Entity" shall mean Subscriber.
Covered Entity.
"Data Aggregation" shall have the same meaning given to such term in 45 C.F.R. § 164.501.
Data Aggregation.
"Designated Record Set" shall have the same meaning given to such term in 45 C.F.R. § 164.501.
Designated Record Set.

"Electronic Protected Health Information" or "ePHI" shall have the same meaning as the term "electronic protected health information" in 45 C.F.R. § 160.103, limited to the information created, received, maintained or transmitted by HealthTap from or on behalf of Subscriber.
Electronic Protected Health Information.
"Health Care Operations" shall have the meaning set out in its definition at 45 C.F.R. § 164.501, as such provision is currently drafted and as it is subsequently updated, amended or revised.
Health Care Operations.

"Individual" shall have the same meaning as the term "individual" in 45 C.F.R. § 160.103 and shall include a person who qualifies as a personal representative in accordance with 45 C.F.R. § 164.502(g)
Individual.
"Privacy Rule" shall mean the Standards for Privacy of Individually Identifiable Health Information at 45 C.F.R. part 160 and part 164.
Privacy Rule.

"Protected Health Information" or "PHI" shall have the same meaning as the term "protected health information" in 45 C.F.R. § 160.103, limited to the information created or received by HealthTap from or on behalf of Subscriber.
Protected Health Information.
"Required By Law" shall have the same meaning as the term "required by law" in 45 C.F.R. § 164.103.
Required By Law.
"Secretary" shall mean the Secretary of the Department of Health and Human Services or his designee.
Secretary.
"Security Rule" shall mean the Standards for Security of Electronic Protected Health Information at 45 C.F.R. part 160 and part 164.
Security Rule.

Any other terms used in this Addendum, but not otherwise defined, shall have the same meaning as those terms in the Privacy Rule, Security Rule, or any other HIPAA Regulations existing now or promulgated in the future.

: Except as otherwise specified herein, HealthTap may use and disclose PHI only as necessary to perform its obligations under the terms of the Agreement. All other uses and disclosures not specifically permitted or required by this Addendum or as required by state or Federal law are strictly prohibited.
Limits on Use and Disclosure of PHI

With regard to the use and/or disclosure of PHI, to the extent that HealthTap is covered by the Privacy Rule, HealthTap shall (a) Not use or further disclose PHI other than as permitted or required by this Addendum or as Required By Law; (b) Use appropriate safeguards to prevent the use or disclosure of PHI other than as provided for by this Addendum; (c) Mitigate, to the extent practicable, any harmful effect that is known to HealthTap of a use or disclosure of PHI by HealthTap in violation of the requirements of this Addendum; (d) Report to Subscriber’s designated privacy officer or other designated administrator or officer, within a reasonable period of time, any use and/or disclosure of the PHI that is not permitted or required by the terms of this Addendum and of which HealthTap becomes aware; (e) Require that any and all agents, including subcontractors, to whom it provides PHI received from, or created or received by HealthTap on behalf of Subscriber agree, in writing, to adhere to the same restrictions and conditions on the use and disclosure of PHI that apply throughout this Addendum to HealthTap with respect to such PHI; (f) Upon request of Subscriber, provide access to PHI maintained by HealthTap on behalf of Subscriber in a Designated Record Set to Subscriber or to an Individual, as directed by Subscriber, in accordance with the requirements of 45 C.F.R. § 164.524 (such access shall be permitted within a reasonable period of time and in a manner designated by Subscriber if HealthTap actually has PHI in a designated record set); (g) Upon request of Subscriber, amend PHI maintained in a Designated Record Set by HealthTap on behalf of Subscriber; (h) Make available its internal books and records relating to the use and disclosure of PHI received from, or created or received by HealthTap on behalf of, Subscriber available to Subscriber, or to the Secretary, in a time and manner designated by Subscriber or the Secretary, for purposes of the Secretary determining Subscriber’s compliance with the Privacy Rule; (i) Document information regarding HealthTap's disclosures of PHI sufficient to permit Subscriber to respond to a request by an Individual for an accounting of disclosures of PHI in accordance with 45 C.F.R. § 164.528; and (j) Upon termination of the Addendum, if feasible, destroy all PHI received from, or created or received by, HealthTap on behalf of Subscriber that HealthTap still maintains in any form and retain no copies of such PHI or, if such return or destruction is not feasible, HealthTap shall extend the protections of this Addendum to such PHI and limit further use or disclosure to those purposes that make the return or destruction of such PHI infeasible, for so long as HealthTap maintains such PHI.
Privacy Rule Obligations and Activities of HealthTap

Except as otherwise limited in this Addendum: (a) HealthTap may use or disclose PHI to perform functions, activities, or services for, or on behalf of, Subscriber as specified in the Agreement, provided that such use or disclosure would not violate the Privacy Rule or other applicable state or federal laws if done by Subscriber itself; (b) HealthTap may use PHI in its possession for the proper management and administration of HealthTap and the HealthTap Services or to carry out the legal responsibilities of HealthTap; (c) HealthTap may disclose PHI for the proper management and administration of HealthTap or the HealthTap Services, provided that such disclosures are Required By Law, or provided that HealthTap represents that it has obtained reasonable assurances, from the person to whom the PHI is disclosed, that it will remain confidential and be used or further disclosed only as Required By Law or for the purpose for which it was disclosed to the person, and that person notifies HealthTap of any instances of which it is aware in which the confidentiality of the PHI received has been breached; (d) Except as otherwise limited in this Addendum, HealthTap may use PHI to provide Data Aggregation services as permitted by 45 C.F.R. § 164.504(e)(2)(i)(B); and (e) HealthTap may use PHI to report violations of law to appropriate state or federal authorities as permitted by 45 C.F.R. § 164.502(j)(1).
Permitted Uses And Disclosures By HealthTap

Subscriber shall: (a) Notify HealthTap of any restriction to the use or disclosure of PHI that Subscriber has agreed to in accordance with 45 C.F.R. § 164.522, provided such changes affect HealthTap’s permitted or required uses and disclosures of PHI; and (b) Not request HealthTap to use or disclose PHI in any manner that would not be permitted under the Privacy Rule if done by Subscriber, except for Data Aggregation or management and administrative activities of HealthTap.
Privacy Rule Obligations of Subscriber.
Term and Termination:

The Term of this Addendum shall be effective as of the commencement of the term of the Agreement, shall automatically renew with the Agreement, and shall terminate when the Agreement terminates. If this Addendum is amended, the Addendum shall renew as Amended.
Term.

Subscriber may terminate this Addendum if HealthTap has breached a material term of this Addendum, and Subscriber: (i) has provided HealthTap with 30 days written notice of the existence of an alleged material breach; and (ii) afforded HealthTap an opportunity to respond and a reasonable period of time no less than 30 days to cure the alleged material breach; and (iii) HealthTap has not so cured the alleged material breach or reached mutually agreeable terms addressing the breach with Subscriber.
Termination for Cause by Subscriber.

Upon HealthTap’s knowledge of a material breach by Subscriber, HealthTap shall either: (i) notify Subscriber of such breach in reasonable detail, and provide an opportunity for Subscriber to cure the breach or violation, or if cure is not possible, HealthTap may immediately terminate this Agreement; or (ii) if neither termination nor cure is feasible, HealthTap shall report the violation to the Secretary.
Termination for Cause by HealthTap.

In the event this Addendum is terminated, the destruction, return or continued maintenance of PHI in possession of HealthTap shall be controlled by Section 3(j) of this Addendum, and HealthTap’s obligations set forth thereunder shall survive termination of this Addendum.
Effect of Termination.
Miscellaneous:
A reference in this Addendum to a section in the Privacy Rule means the section as in effect or as amended, and for which compliance is required.
Regulatory References.
Any ambiguity in this Addendum shall be resolved in favor of a meaning that permits Subscriber to comply with the Privacy Rule and the Security Rule.
Interpretation.
The validity, enforceability and interpretation of this Addendum shall be governed by the same laws as are applicable to the Agreement and where applicable by the Privacy Rule and the Security Rule.
Applicable Law.

We value your privacy, and this Privacy Statement describes how we will protect and handle the personal information that you provide to us through our HealthTap Web-based and mobile based service, and related web sites. Among other things, the HealthTap Privacy Statement explains:
If you choose to sign up for HealthTap, what information we ask you for during registration.
That we do not include any Personally Identifiable Information in your HealthTap Public Profile.
That we do not use or share your Personally Identifiable Information, other than as described in our Privacy Statement.
How we secure the information we collect by meeting or exceeding generally accepted industry standards and by using SSL encryption.

To help you understand how our Site works, and to help you quickly find information you care about, we’ve written the Privacy Statement as a series of questions and answers, and included our privacy policies in the answers to the questions.

When you sign up for HealthTap you verify that you’ve read and agree to our Privacy Statement. Since you are agreeing to what’s contained in this document when using the Site, we encourage you to read it (if you haven't already).
A Message from HealthTap on Privacy:

"We care about your privacy. This Privacy Statement describes what information you can share with us, how that information is stored, how we use that information, and what information other users can see when they use the site.
Privacy policies are important documents, but many people don't read them because they are too long, are confusing, or are written in 'legalese.'

We've designed this Privacy Statement with our users in mind, and have created links to the most common questions users may have about the site and how it works where privacy issues are raised. This allows you to access quickly the information that may be important to you. We've included privacy information related to these topics together with the answers to these common questions. We’ve written everything in plain language.

In addition to this Privacy Statement, HealthTap has taken another step to share with you our commitment to privacy. We’ve created a Privacy Constitution and User Bill of Rights that describes our core beliefs about privacy and your core rights as a user of our site. These documents are located on our Privacy and Secure Sharing page, together with suggestions about how to share securely and anonymously on HealthTap."

HealthTap brings together health data, health information, and a community of users to help you live a happier, healthier life. By helping you find relevant medical information, connecting you with people who are similar to you, and showing you what actions they are taking, HealthTap provides you with personalized health and wellness information to share with your doctor and support your health decisions.

Each user on HealthTap creates a Health Activity. Your Health Activity contains information that you choose to share with HealthTap. For example, you can share basic information about yourself (such as your height and weight), and personal health goals (such as losing weight), or information about health conditions you are managing (such as high blood pressure). Sharing is up to you. You can share as much or as little information as you like. Sharing is not required to use HealthTap. The more information you choose to share, the more personalized HealthTap becomes.

We believe that collective sharing can revolutionize the type of and way that personal health information is brought to you. HealthTap uses your Health Activity and your stated health and wellness goals to:
Let you store and manage data about your symptoms, health conditions, and information about your health and well-being goals and challenges
Find and access information about what other people like you are doing, and learn what actions they are taking and what’s working for them

Yes. Your use of HealthTap is anonymous. Your real name, date of birth, e-mail address, and other Personally Identifiable Information are not visible on the site to other users. You select a name under which you appear when using the Site (a Public Profile Name). You can stay anonymous by selecting a confidential Public Profile Name and by keeping that private. HealthTap uses bank-level security and encryption. More about our security measures can be found
on our Secure Sharing and Privacy page.

HealthTap is designed with your privacy in mind. Users are identified by a Public Profile Name that they choose and can change at any time. Safeguarding your privacy and anonymity online takes a little common sense. We've provided some tips about how to

No. We have a strict “NO-SPAM” policy. We won’t ever sell, trade or give away any email address you enter, unless you tell us it’s OK. The e-mail address entered when you log into HealthTap is not visible to anyone but you. We've provided more information

To receive the benefits of HealthTap you will need to create an account. When you create an account we ask you for some basic information, such as your name, e-mail address, and date of birth. No additional data is required to use the Site.

We ask for your date of birth because this helps us provide you with a personalized and tailored online heath experience. Health conditions and the actions that may work best for you often depend on your age group. Telling us your age also helps us find people who are more like you. Only your age, not your date of birth, is visible to other users. The use of your date of birth is governed by this Privacy Statement.

Your email address will be used to create an account. When you sign up for an account, you will also create a password. You use your e-mail address to log into HealthTap. We will use this to send you an email requesting that you validate your account and may also use it to provide you with notices from us about your HealthTap account.

You can review and update your account information and modify, add, or delete any optional information by signing into your HealthTap account, and editing your Account Profile. You can change your e-mail address there any time.

Yes. Your e-mail address is not displayed in your Public Profile, and is never visible to other users on HealthTap. For more information about how we keep your Personally Identifiable information safe and secure, see

You can share additional data with us as you use the Site to help us tailor the information you see and to increase the usefulness and personalization of our service. For example, some users will want to receive the benefit of improved answers to their questions through sharing data like frequency of symptoms (i.e., 1-2 headaches per week), actions (i.e., 20 minutes of moderate exercise each day), or health conditions (i.e., high blood pressure). If you choose to share personal information with us, it will be used as described in this Privacy Statement.

If you choose to use our Send An Answer feature to send a friend a Medical Expert’s answer to a question on the Site, we will ask you for your friend’s email address. We will automatically send your friend a one-time email inviting him or her to view the Content. HealthTap does not store this information, and uses it for the sole purpose of sending this one-time email.

Personally Identifiable Information is information that identifies specifically who you are. This includes information such as your full name and your e-mail address. We keep this information private by not displaying it or sharing it. We keep this information secure, using state of the art encryption among other security measures. More information about our security can be found on our

We do not display this information on HealthTap, except inside of your Account Profile, which is visible only to you. If you choose to reveal any such information (for example, by telling another user your real name in a Message), that is your choice.

We will retain your Personally Identifiable Information, like your e-mail address, for as long as your account is active or as needed to provide you services. We will retain and use your Personally Identifiable Information as necessary to comply with our legal obligations, resolve disputes, and enforce our agreements.

Everyone who has created an account on HealthTap has a Health Activity. Your Health Activity is a collection of data that you share with HealthTap when using the site. You can see, add, modify, and remove data from your Health Activity at any time.
Examples of the types of data that you may be able to store in your Health Activity include:

Yes. You can edit the data in your Health Activity by changing or deleting it at any time. The changes you make are permanent. You will be asked to confirm any changes or deletions from your Health Activity before they are made final.
What is My Public Profile?

Every user has a Public Profile. Your Public Profile is how other users will see you on the Site. Your Public Profile is your Public Profile Name, and an image or avatar you choose (your Public Profile Picture). It does not contain any Personally Identifiable Information, unless you put such information in your Public Profile Name or Public Profile Picture. Do not use your real name, picture or any other Personally Identifiable Information in your Public Profile Name and avatar. Each user’s Public Profile is linked to that user’s Health Activity, so that all users on the Site can find similar Public Profiles, and so that we can all share in communal health learning.
For example, a user with the name “NewMom” might have a Public Profile that includes the following:
she reports having a condition (high cholesterol)
she’s taking actions for that condition (exercising 30 minutes per day, taking a prescription medication, and eliminating certain foods from her diet)
she’s following other HealthTap users
she has recently reported finding specific content on the site useful (a page about when parents of newborns can expect the baby to sleep through the night)

As this example shows, some of the information stored in you Health Activity is displayed in your Public Profile. Your real name, and other Personally Identifiable Information, are never shown in your Public Profile (unless you put it there). You can turn off sharing of various site features, including Health Activity sharing, at any time.
How you use the site and what you choose to share are entirely up to you.

IF YOU CHOOSE TO SHARE INFORMATION OUTISDE OF HEALTAP, THIS IS YOUR CHOICE. THERE IS ALWAYS A CHANCE THAT INFOMRATION YOU SHARE OUTSIDE OF HEALTHTAP MAY BE USED IN AN ATTEMPT T IDENTIFY YOU OR MAY BE USED IN WAYS THAT YOU OR HEALTHTAP CANNOT CONTROL.
children’s privacy

Some HealthTap users are also caregivers who are responsible for managing the health of other loved ones (for example, a mother with a baby). A care recipient is a person whose health is under the custody of the caregiver, or who has granted a caregiver permission to provide data about the care recipient to HealthTap. Caregivers must be over the age of 18. If a care recipient is under the age of 13, and the care recipient wishes to enter any information into HealthTap, please see the section below on protecting
Yes. Every user of HealthTap, whether or not the user is a caregiver or care recipient, must have a different account. Currently, a parent may add a separate child’s account through their account.
Where a caregiver has the right or the appropriate permission to provide data about a care recipient, a caregiver can provide data to that care recipient’s account.

Yes. You can close your account at any time by signing into your HealthTap account and choosing “Delete Account” from your Account Settings. You will receive an e-mail confirming that your account has been deleted.

Your account contains data that you have provided to HealthTap, including information in your Account Settings and Health Activity. After you close your account all of your personally identifiable information is deleted.
No. After you close your account your account settings and your personally identifiable health information will be deleted.
What is a Public Profile and a Public Profile Name?

Each HealthTap user has a Public Profile. HealthTap allows users to find other people who are similar to them by navigating through the site. Each user's Public Profile contains information that is visible to other users on HealthTap. To protect your identity, your real name or other Personally Identifiable Information is never displayed in your Public Profile.

Each user also creates a Public Profile Name. You real name is never visible to other HealthTap users. Only the Public Profile Name (i.e. your “screen name”) appears together with your Public Profile.

HealthTap allows users to “follow” other users and to request to “connect” with each other. HealthTap does not reveal your real name or any other Personally Identifiable Information to users when they Following or Connect with each other. At all times, users are identified to each other by their Public Profile Name.

When one user follows another, the follower will see certain information about the user being followed. This information includes certain updates that the user being followed provides to HealthTap and that appear in the Public Profile of the user being followed.

We allow users to connect with each other. Connecting is not automatic and requires the approval of both users. When one user requests to connect with another HealthTap user, this request must be accepted by the recipient before it is activated. If a request is denied, the two parties will not be Connected.

Yes. Only connected users can send each other messages. If you choose to accept a connection, you will be able to send and receive Messages (through your HealthTap Messages Box) with your Connections.
Yes. You can un-connect from a Connection at any time through your Account Settings.

In the future you will be able to block other users from following you, sending you connection requests. Currently, you can prevent other users from seeing information in your Public Profile by adjusting your Privacy Settings.

Your use of HealthTap is designed to be anonymous. However, if you’d like additional privacy, your can change your sharing preferences in the Privacy and Sharing tab in your Settings to adjust what information other people see in connection with your Public Profile Name. You can change these settings to control if everyone, only your connections, or no one sees this information, and can even adjust these settings for specific pieces of information (for example, you can keep your age private, but share with everyone that you are pregnant).
Every HealthTap user has a Messages Box. A Message is an electronic mail message sent to or from your Messages Box.

You will be notified that you have a Message when you log into HealthTap. HealthTap will also send you an e-mail (to the e-mail address you use to log into HealthTap, or other e-mail address you specify in your Account Settings) letting you know that you've received a Message on the site. These notification e-mails do not show you what's in the message you've received. To view a Message you must sign in to HealthTap and open the message in your Messages Box. You can turn off these notifications in your Account Settings.

Yes. After you sign up for HealthTap, we will send you a message welcoming you to our community and thanking you for joining us. After that, HealthTap may occasionally send messages to your HealthTap Messages Box, or to an e-mail address you provide to us. No one likes Spam, we do not send our users Spam, and we have a strict No-Spam policy. As described elsewhere in this Privacy Statement, HealthTap may also send you notifications (which you can turn off) and important messages to the e-mail address listed in your Account Settings.
You can only send a Message to, or receive a Message from, a user to whom you are connected.

Yes. Connected users can send each other Messages through the HealthTap message system. Only users who are Connected can exchange Messages. Messages will appear in your HealthTap Messages Box. Additionally, your e-mail address will be used to notify you that you have a message on HealthTap. You can turn off this notifications feature at any time through your Account Settings.

HealthTap does not read or monitor Messages. Additionally, we do not and cannot control what happens to messages once they have been sent to other users. As described below, this Privacy Statement does not apply to Message communications between users.

No. HealthTap does not monitor the information exchanged in Messages. You choose what, and what not, you share in these communications. HealthTap does not control any information you provide to another user through Messages, and this Privacy Statement does not apply to these communications. Additionally, the HealthTap Privacy Statement does not apply to any communications you have with other users outside of HealthTap. We encourage you to think carefully before sharing any personally identifiable information (such as an external e-mail address or a phone number) in these communications.

Registered HealthTap users can submit informational questions for posting on the Site. Questions are reviewed prior to posting. Once posted, other users and HealthTap Medical Experts can view and answer questions. Users can vote on the helpfulness of posted answers to questions.

Questions and answers on HealthTap are for general education and information. Only general, informational questions are permitted. For specific, personal health questions, always ask your own doctor or healthcare provider. (HealthTap Medical Experts are not your personal doctor or healthcare provider, and their answers to questions are not personal or for personal use.)

Posting Personally Identifiable Information (such as a real name, phone number, or e-mail address) is not permitted anywhere on the Site, including but not limited to user submitted questions or comments. Posting such information, about yourself or another person, is a violation of our Terms of Use. Do not include Personally Identifiable Information about you or anyone else in questions, comments or any other submissions that are publicly visible. HealthTap reserves the right to remove such information from questions or comments. IF YOU INCLUDE PERSONALLY IDENTIFIABLE INFORMATION IN ANY PUBLICLY VISIBLE SUBMISSION TO THE SITE THIS INFORMATION MAY BE USED IN WAYS THAT YOU OR HEALTHTAP CANNOT CONTROL.

. If we are unable to remove this information for any reason, we will let you know that we are unable to do so and why. You can control what is visible in your Public Profile through your Account Settings.

Our Site offers publicly accessible areas (“Public Areas”). Public Areas include, but are not limited to, questions, Answers, Tips, and information visible in your Public Profile. You should be aware that any information you provide in these areas might be read, collected, and used by others who access them. To request removal of your Personally Identifiable Information from these areas, contact us at
provide you with important information about HealthTap, including updates and notifications;
send you email and/or mobile alerts (if you opt into mobile alerts);
help you determine appropriate services relevant to you, your lifestyle and your geographic location.

We may access and/or disclose your personal information, including your Personally Identifiable Information, if we believe in good faith that such action is necessary to: (a) comply with the law or legal process served on us; (b) protect and defend our rights or property (including the enforcement of our agreements); or (c) act in urgent circumstances to protect the personal safety and welfare of HealthTap users or members of the public. Personal information collected on HealthTap is currently stored and processed in the United States.

Aggregated information is information from multiple users that is not associated with any individual user account, statistics are summaries of information, not associated with any individual user account, and de-identified data does not include Personally Identifiable Information, such as first and last names or e-mail addresses. Aggregated information and de-identified data and statistics are used to run our service. We may use aggregated information or de-identified data gathered from HealthTap and related statistics to improve the services provided through HealthTap, and for research and analysis. We may also provide this information to our partners for such purposes.

One of HealthTap’s features is a “Doctor Visit Prep Sheet.” You can use the Doctor Visit Prep Sheet if you want to share information from HealthTap with your doctor. You can view and print a summary of certain information that you provide to us, together with information that may be useful when you visit your doctor. We call this collection of information your Doctor Visit Prep Sheet. It also includes questions you may wish to ask your doctor.

The Doctor Visit Prep Sheet is NOT a medical record, and any questions included in the sharing summary are standardized and are not a complete list of the questions that you may wish to ask your doctor. What you ask your doctor and share with your doctor is up to you. Before viewing or printing an Doctor Visit Prep Sheet sharing summary you will be reminded that HealthTap is not a doctor, and to use common sense if you choose to present this form to your doctor, professional healthcare provider, or use it in any other way.
for more information about how to use our service.

HealthTap offers information to support the health decisions that you decide to make, in connection with the medical advice and guidance you receive from your doctor. The choices you make are yours. HealthTap does not provide medical advice, is not a doctor, and the information on HealthTap should not be used to delay or replace professional medical treatment. HealthTap does not make recommendations or endorsements. Please see our

Yes. You can edit or delete information in your Health Activity by signing in to your HealthTap account and editing your Health Activity. Once you edit or delete a record, you cannot retrieve the prior record.
What are Tips and are they private?

Tips are bite-sized suggestions written by a Medical Expert (or written by a user and verified by a Medical Expert). Tips can be information, actions to do, or just something to remember. Lists are collections of Tips. Users can add tips to their HealthTap Personal Checklist. Tips can be one time or recurring. When a recurring tip is created, the author can specify frequency (how often the tip will appear on a Checklist). Tips posted to the Site appear publicly and are shared with other users. You can control the visibility tips you add to your own list through your Privacy & Sharing tab in your Settings.

Yes. While every user will be able to see basic information about you, such as your Public Profile Name and your Public Profile Picture, you can control what other information is shown about you through your Privacy & Sharing tab in your Settings.

You can share certain information from our site (such as a user question you find helpful) using sign-in services such as Facebook and Twitter Connect. Services like Facebook Connect give you the option to post information about certain activities on this Web site to your profile page to share with others within your network. We have designed HealthTap to be anonymous and encourage you to think carefully before making posts using Facebook and Twitter connect.

To keep you informed of alerts relating to your health and wellness goals or health actions, HealthTap may send you emails and or mobile alerts. You can opt out of receiving emails and/or mobile alerts at any time, under your Account Settings.
. More information about our security measures is located on our
page; if this information does not answer your specific question, you can contact us at

The security of your personal information is a top priority for us. We are committed to protecting the security of your personal information. Experts design our security measures, and we use a variety of technologies and procedures to help protect the security of your personal information from unauthorized access, use, and disclosure. For example, information transferred between you and the site is encrypted. We restrict access to personal information to HealthTap employees, contractors, and agents who need to know that information in order to operate, develop, or improve our services. These individuals are bound by confidentiality obligations and may be subject to discipline, including termination and criminal prosecution, if they fail to meet these obligations. No method of transmission over the Internet, or method of electronic storage, is 100% secure, however. Therefore, we cannot guarantee its absolute security. If you have any specific questions about security on our Site, please see our

The use of cookies by any of our partners, affiliates, or service providers (such as Google Maps) are not covered by our Privacy Statement. We do not have access or control over these cookies. Our partners, affiliates, service providers may use current session ID cookies to help us improve performance and functionality of the Site.

As is true of most Web sites, we and our third party tracking service use log giles to gather certain information automatically and store it in log files. This information includes Internet Protocol (IP) addresses, browser type, Internet Service Provider (ISP), referring/exit pages, operating system, date/time stamp, and clickstream data. We use this information, which does not identify individual users, to analyze trends, to administer the site, to track users’ movements around the site and to gather demographic information about our user base as a whole.

Currently, we only let you provide us with information about you (except in the case of a Caregiver providing information about a Care Recipient). This Privacy Statement applies to this information. In the future, we may allow users to provide us with information by or through other separately operated products or services.

HealthTap does not share your Personally Identifiable Information (for example, your real name or e-mail address) with anyone. HealthTap works by helping you find reliable and personalized health information. As part of this service, HealthTap may provide you with information about external service providers (“Service Providers”) that may be of interest or use to you (for example, a health clinic). HealthTap does not provide these external Service Providers with any Personally Identifiable Information about you, without your express consent. Service Providers cannot access your Health Activity or other health and wellness information through HealthTap.
. We cannot provide legal advice.

This Privacy Statement does not apply to other service providers or links to other sites that are not owned or controlled by HealthTap, and you should read the individual privacy polices and terms of service of these providers before using their services. We encourage you to contact us if you believe a provider is not protecting the privacy or security of your health and wellness information. You may contact us in writing at:

Some users may want to share personal information with a Service Provider. You can always do this on your own. If we allow this in the future, before you share any information with a Service Provider through HealthTap, we will require you to confirm that you agree to any such sharing.

We may occasionally update this Privacy Statement. When we do, we will also revise the "last modified" date at the top of the Privacy Statement. For extremely important changes to this Privacy Statement, we will notify you either by placing a prominent notice on the home page of HealthTap, or by sending you an e-mail notification and/or a Message.

We are committed to protecting the privacy of children. This Site is not intended or designed for children under the age of 13. We do not collect Personally Identifiable Information from any person we actually know is a child under the age of 13. A Caregiver may use this site for a Care Recipient who is under the age of 13, but the Care Recipient may not enter any Personally Identifiable Information into the site – all such information must be entered by the Caregiver.

Since you’ve asked the question

by Updating Your Profile and Answering three or more Questions

then complete your registration by updating the information on your Medical Home - select "Medical Home" from your home page and add your personal information to the About section.

own blog, website, and in other publications. You can automatically syndicate your posts on other

simply provide more quality responses to questions and add more Tips on HealthTap.
All Answers and Tips you post will link back to your Medical Home Page. You can broaden your visibility by contributing more content,
which will also help new patients find you. Your Medical Home can also serve as a valuable resource for your existing patients, before and between visits.

We know you’ve been waiting a while for an answer to your question, and we’d like to thank you for your patience. We just want to let you know that not all questions on HealthTap receive answers. A question is likely to go unanswered if it lacks detail, the question is unclear, or if it contains terms with which the doctors are not familiar. We are writing to let you know that your question is much more likely to receive a response if you improve it by editing or resubmitting it.
We encourage you to look at relevant information for your question and use it to improve your question. You’ll find an amazing amount of questions and existing answers on HealthTap.
See Similar Questions and discover related topics:
With our huge database of questions and health topics, chances are you’ll find something similar. We encourage you to look through similar questions to find the answer you’re looking for.
After you review similar content, we suggest you
to add enough detail to make it meaningful, answerable, and easy to understand. Please remember to only ask about one topic in your question, and double-check your spelling and grammar.
Thanks for editing your question! We know it will help us find you the answer you’re seeking.

We know you’re still waiting on an answer and want to thank you for your patience. Our doctors are still working overtime to answer the questions pouring in from across the globe. We really want to help you find the answer you’re looking for and we encourage you to take one of the following actions to improve your chance of finding a great answer from a top doctor:
Review Similar Content:

With our huge database of millions of questions and answers from leading doctors, chances are you’re likely to find similar questions that already have great answers from multiple doctors, that were peer reviewed by other doctors too!
See related topics »
Did the content on these pages answer your question?
Edit your question:

If you don’t find an answer you’re 100% happy with by looking at similar questions on HealthTap, feel free to edit and improve your question. Our doctors are able to select which questions to answer, and may skip questions that aren’t answerable, clear, and/or detailed. Ways to improve your question include: add enough detail to make it meaningful, answerable, and easy to understand; ask about just one topic in your question; and double-check your spelling and grammar.
Expedite for only $0.99:
If you’d like to get your question answered faster, you can also donate 99 cents to charity and we’ll give your questions a higher priority.
Thanks for asking!
