Reference Guide: How to Write a Great HealthTap Answer

Do not provide medical care through HealthTap. HealthTap is a website, not a doctor, and therefore is not a substitute for your face-to-face professional medical advice, diagnosis rendering, and treatment of disorders. Write your answers mainly to give information.
Too direct:
You have jock itch, so buy some OTC Lotrimin cream and use it twice a day for 2 weeks. Keep your groin dry, and your rash should be gone in a couple of weeks.
Much better:

Itchy, reddened, slightly flaky skin in the groin skin folds can be from jock itch or other causes. Jock itch (tinea cruris) is caused by a fungus germ, and is usually treated with over-the-counter Lotrimin AF cream or with prescription anti-fungal medication from a doctor.
Add a personal touch to your answer to humanize the online interaction.
Examples:
Include a hint of humor if appropriate; wish the member “good luck”, “have a great day”, or “hope you get well soon”; or add a comforting picture or image.

Make your answer long enough to be helpful to others, because thousands of people all over the world may read your answer. Answers of less than 4 words are bad answers (just imagine the member sitting, facing you, and only hearing 4 words from you).
Too brief:
Do another pregnancy test.
If a first over-the-counter (OTC) urine pregnancy test is negative, but a woman really feels that she is pregnant, she can do another OTC urine pregnancy test one week later.
Put some details in your answer. Details help members understand their problems.
Adequate:
Eat foods that have few calories.
One should eat foods that have few calories such as carrots, celery sticks, and iceberg lettuce; but use no salad dressing or only a bit of low-calorie dressing.
Consider adding a picture or other image to your answer, to emphasize your point, help explain a fact, or just make your answer more appealing.
Example:
Add a picture of an ambulance when informing a member that the usual recommendation, for people with the symptoms he asks about, is to go to an Emergency Room.
Use the most widely known drug name, or use both the brand and generic names, when talking about medications.
One may try acetaminophen but see the doctor if fever persists.
One may try Tylenol (acetaminophen) or Motrin/Advil (ibuprofen) if the fever is not high, but should see a doctor if fever goes higher or lasts more than 2 days.
Use good grammar and punctuation, reflecting the many years of a doctor's higher education.
Poor form:
A person can hurt their arms if you do too many reps too much weight or bad technique
A person can hurt his arm muscles by doing too many repetitions, using too much weight, or having poor weight-lifting techniques.
Don't assume every HealthTap member speaks English well or has a higher education. Explain long words and avoid medical abbreviations.
Not good:
The G.I. doc may order fecal occult blood x3 to screen for colon ca.
The gastroenterologist (stomach/intestines specialist) may order a stool test to check for traces of blood in the stool, on 3 separate days, to look for signs of colon cancer.

with a single facebook post, so we asked her to share her secrets.
“Wonder how I'm getting all those subscriptions? Here are three pointers to help you. I don't have much sales experience, but I do love telling stories. Any good story has to answer three questions:
1. Who is this story for?
2. Why does this story matter?
3. What do you want the reader to do or get out of it?

These three questions and their answers can help you get to where you want to do: making money by telling your audience about a service that will benefit them. We’re looking for enthusiastic HealthTappers to join us this coming Tuesday (1/28) and Thursday (1/30) in Palo Alto, California for several limited filming slots.

If you aren’t able to join us in person on the 28th or 30th, you can still participate in this video project by sharing with us how HealthTap helped you or a loved one live a happier, healthier, better or longer life. You can share:
A quality video of you telling your HealthTap story.
An audio clip of you telling your HealthTap story.
Your HealthTap story, written in your own words.
We’ll be featuring stories to inspire millions everywhere and would love to hear from you!

Quick guide to getting your questions answered on HealthTap
Be Easy to Understand

Questions must be in English, easy to understand, and about health or wellness topics. Common abbreviations are fine to use, but avoid unusual abbreviations. HealthTap experts are U.S.-licensed doctors and seldom answer questions about uniquely foreign medications, or about hospitals and procedures in other countries.
Ask Meaningful Questions

Questions must include enough detail to be meaningful and answerable. Vague questions that name a topic (for example, “I have a discharge”) without asking something specific are hard to answer. Try to mention whether the question is about a man or a woman, whether the topic relates to a certain age group, how long ago the symptoms started, and which parts of the body are affected.
Check Spelling of Words and Medicines

Doctors may not understand a question if it contains many misspelled words. Lab test results should not be just numbers, but should include the units of measurement (such as pounds or mg/24hr). If you mention a medication not available in the United States, be sure to include the generic name or the American brand name.
Stay Private
Do not include your name, names of other people, nor doctors’ names in the question.
If You’re a Minor, Get an Adult to Help
The doctors avoid answering questions from minors under the age of 18, so parents should ask questions for the teens and children.

How does this work?
A patient has a question that requires more in-depth communication.
The patient reaches out to you and initiates a private, paid interaction with you. We call these “House Calls.”
You are sent the patient's initial message, requesting a paid reply.
Answer the patent's question. The patient will then be allowed to send you a short follow-up question, which you should also respond to.
Receive payment for your expertise and support!
We know that health information is personal. That's why messages on HealthTap are secure. We take this stuff very, very seriously.

Congratulations, you’ve been approved as a HealthTap Prime doctor. Welcome to the team!

Your start date has been deferred because we don’t have available shifts at the times you selected, or in the state(s) you practice in. We have simply experienced so much success that we are at capacity right now. However, we are thrilled that you are on board, and as soon as the opportunity arises, we will offer you shifts. Millions of patients around the world are seeking doctors with your expertise!

Indeed, if you like, you can start seeing patient's right away by making yourself "Available" on an ad-hoc basis to accept consults from any patients waiting in the queue when our shift doctors are busy seeing other patients.

And of course, you can always answer members’ questions, curate articles and research, create tips and checklists--and do all the other things that will raise your DocScore™ and make people smile and feel good.

We’ll contact you when the situation changes. In the meantime, we recommend checking that your profile is up to date, and that it contains all your qualifications, accolades, and practice information, so that you achieve the highest DocScore™ possible. Virtual Consultants with higher DocScores™ take precedence when it comes to scheduling. Staying active in the Medical Expert Network and providing helpful answers to members’ questions that other doctors agree with will also help your DocScore.
We look forward to working with you!

What is HealthTap Concierge?

HealthTap Concierge is an easy-to-use and affordable service that empowers you to offer state-of-the-art virtual care (via live video, voice, and text chat consults; or by secure message consults) to your patients as an extension to your real-world practice. With HealthTap Concierge, you can conduct virtual consults with your patients anytime, anywhere, on any PC, Mac, or mobile device (iPhone, iPad, or Android smartphone or tablet) with a strong and reliable internet connection. This service allows you to increase efficiency, improve care for your patients, and boost revenue to your practice.
Why do I need a Virtual Practice?

Are you ready to be well compensated for the time you spend helping your patients by email and phone? Many doctors are now consulting their patients virtually and getting paid for responding to previously uncompensated questions, simple problems, and requests for medication refills. You can even order lab tests; then when the lab results are made available to you on HealthTap, you will be able to share your insights to guide your patients. Increase efficiency in your practice by giving virtual consults to patients who do not need to see you in your office. Bonus: your patients will love the flexibility and convenient access to your high-quality care!
How much does this cost?

Imagine opening a new office that has global reach for a tiny fraction of the cost of starting a new practice location. The monthly HealthTap Concierge license is only $350/month for the technology, service, and dedicated support, and you can take advantage of significant savings in the annual plan (15% discount, or $3,570/year—just $298/month). You'll also benefit from a reduced transaction fee of $10 for each consult (compare that to the usual $19/consult in HealthTap Concierge Lite). Contact us at 650-376-6010 or concierge@healthtap.com for information about additional discounts for groups of 5 or more doctors!
What kind of support do I get in this service?

Our goal is to help you meet your goals. We'll partner closely with you and your staff to help you delight your patients and boost your income. Your dedicated Account Manager is an expert in virtual care and will provide individual training and support for you, your staff, and other practicing physicians in your group.
How many consults am I going to get? What am I going to earn?

The sky’s the limit! You will be increasingly successful in HealthTap Concierge as you introduce more and more of your patients to the service, experiment with use cases that fit your practice and patients, and discover the best ways to attract new patients to your Virtual Practice. Your dedicated Account Manager will help you identify specific opportunities for you to give virtual care in your practice, based on the uses that best apply to your clinical setting. For example, we'll help train your staff to suggest a virtual appointment every time a patient calls the office to cancel an appointment or requests a medication refill. When you do just 1 consult per day, you can earn an extra $2,000+/month! (Based on current average pricing for limited and extended visits.)
Can I prescribe medication and order lab tests?

You can easily write electronic prescriptions for non-controlled medications, which are instantly sent to your patient's preferred pharmacy upon completion of the consult. You can also order diagnostic lab tests from Quest Diagnostics; the results are sent back to you in the consult interface so you may easily review and comment on them.
How do billing and EMR integration work?

If your EMR is certified to the Meaningful use phase 2 standard, we can usually set you up to receive copies of your consult notes directly in your EMR. Depending on your individual billing system, you may choose to set your consult fee to a small copay and generate patient bills directly from your office. We collect patient payments upfront at whatever rates you set, and we can help you navigate the insurance reimbursement process. The ability to collect from third-party insurers for virtual care does vary from state to state, but for 37 states that have parity legislation, tele-health visits are paid at the same rates as the equivalent office-based services.
How do I downgrade?
You can downgrade to Concierge Lite anytime up to 5 days before your next billing date. Charges are non-refundable. If you change your plan, it will go into effect at the end of your billing cycle.
at least five days before your next billing date so you won’t be charged for the next billing cycle.

Choose your preferred shifts for performing Virtual Consults on the schedule below. Sign up today to secure the days and times that work best for you (spots are limited and allocated on a first-come, first-serve basis).

You guarantee your availability to take consults for the duration of the shift, and in exchange, are eligible for base salary payments for shifts as a function of patient demand. These doctors are preferentially routed patients before On Standby or Ad-Hoc doctors.

You are on call to cover a doctor in the event of a shift cancellation or high patient demand. If notified, you should sign in to your shift within 30 minutes of notice and see patients for the duration of the shift. You will be paid per consult. Doctors who cover shifts from On Standby are routed patients before Ad-Hoc doctors.

As a HealthTap Prime doctor you have the ultimate flexibility to also check in or check out of being “Available” to take consults from patients in the queue. However, doctors on shift will get preference in accepting these consults over doctors who are available Ad-Hoc

Virtual Consult Insurance Terms

You, a physician applying to or currently providing virtual consults on HealthTap or any physician on whose behalf this Agreement is entered into (“Provider”), agree to designate HealthTap to purchase and maintain malpractice insurance with a minimum annual coverage of one million dollars per incident and three million dollars in aggregate, or HealthTap’s subsequent liability minimums, to cover any acts of malpractice committed during the performance of virtual consults on HealthTap, subject to any limitations specified herein or in the policy (“Insurance”). Generally, the Insurance provides claims-made coverage for medical malpractice claims brought in the U.S., including U.S. claims made by claimants in other countries. The coverage excludes consults or interactions outside of the HealthTap platform, claims brought outside of the U.S., and is not available to Providers with no other means of participating in a Patient Compensation Fund (“PCF”) program if the Provider practices in a state where PCF participation is required. The Insurance is secondary to any other applicable or available insurance policy. Provider agrees to provide to HealthTap or the Insurance carrier, upon request, information related to your medical practice, licensure, or events or circumstances likely to impact coverage eligibility. This agreement is in addition to any other agreements governing use of the HealthTap platform, and any representations and warranties therein. In the event of a claim covered or potentially covered by the Insurance and related to services provided under this Agreement and on or through a HealthTap platform (including the HealthTap website and mobile apps), Provider agrees to comply with the terms required by the Insurance to receive the benefit of coverage and to: (i) cooperate with the investigation, settlement of defense of any claim(s); (ii) immediately send HealthTap copies of any demands, notices, summons or legal papers received in connection with a claim; (iii) notify any other insurer whose coverage is or may be available; (iv) cooperate with the insurer with respect to coordinating any other available or potentially available insurance; (v) provide the insurer with written authorization to (a) obtain records and other information related to the claim, and (b) conduct and control the defense of the Physician in such claim. By opting into this program, Provider agrees that HealthTap may withhold an additional administrative fee for the provision of this service from any payments to Provider. Currently this fee is one dollar ($1) per consult, on top of any other fees applicable to the performance of consults through the HealthTap platform. Provider may opt out of this coverage at any time, but waiting periods may apply to any future request to participate in this program. HealthTap retains the rights to end this program or to end Provider’s participation in this program at any time and for any reason, and shall provide Provider with written notice of any such termination, in which case coverage shall apply to virtual consults up to the date of such termination.

This Subscription Agreement (this “Agreement”) made on that date when the medical practice or doctor signatory hereto (the “Practice”) agrees to the terms of this Agreement by e- signing and/or clicking on the appropriate box hereof (the “Effective Date”), and HEALTHTAP, INC., a Delaware corporation, located at 270 University Avenue, Floor 2, Palo Alto, California 94301 (“HealthTap”). , the Practice is a medical practice licensed to practice medicine and in good standing with the state-specific medical board overseeing the licensed Practice;
WHEREAS

, HealthTap has developed and implemented a web-based and mobile-based software application for remote consultations conducted via video, audio, or live chat, and/or through any other means that HealthTap may adopt, from time to time (the “Remote Medical Consultations”), as more fully set forth on Schedule A attached hereto and made a part hereof (collectively the “Services”); and

, the Practice desires to license use of the Services set forth on Schedule A (collectively, the “Licensed Services”) from HealthTap, and HealthTap desires to license use of the Licensed Services to the Practice, pursuant to the terms and conditions of this Agreement.
, for good and valuable consideration, the receipt and sufficiency of which is hereby acknowledged, the Parties, intending to be legally bound, hereby agree as follows:
NOW, THEREFORE
LICENSE AND USE

HealthTap hereby grants the Practice, upon the terms and conditions contained herein, a non-transferable, non-exclusive license for all licensed professionals associated with the Practice (collectively, “Licensed Users”) to use the Licensed Services, during the Term (as defined in Section 11 below) in accordance with HealthTap’s then current documentation and only: (i) in the ordinary course of the Practice’s normal and ordinary internal business, and (ii) for purposes that are in accordance with applicable federal, state, and local laws, rules, and regulations (“Intended Purpose”). The Practice covenants and agrees that the Licensed Services shall not be used by any person or entity other than the Licensed Users for the Intended Purpose and shall prevent any subcontractor or agent of the Practice or any other third party from using the Licensed Services.
In furtherance of Section 2(a) hereof, the Practice shall not, and shall not permit any third party (including, but not limited to, affiliates, employees or agents of any third party)

to: (i) duplicate, modify, decompile or reverse engineer any of the Licensed Services for any reason; or (ii) resell the Licensed Services to any unrelated third party. This is a license, not a sale. The Practice shall not, and shall not allow anyone to: (1) circumvent any security feature of the Licensed Services; (2) use the Licensed Services to provide services (including processing, commercial timesharing, rental, sharing, application service provider, “service office,” or “service bureau” arrangements) to any third party; (3) permit any third party to view, use, access, or copy the Licensed Services; or (4) disclose, publish, broadcast, sell, or otherwise redistribute the Licensed Services. The Practice shall maintain the confidentiality and security of any password, account, and other identification information provided with respect to the Licensed Services and not to provide it to any other person or entity (including, but not limited to affiliates, employees or agents of any third party). The Practice shall be responsible for all use of, and activities that occur under, its password(s), account, and other identification information and for any actions that take place through its access to the Licensed Services (whether conducted by the Practice or another). The Practice agrees to use the Licensed Services only for the Intended Purpose.
. HealthTap reserves the right to modify the Licensed Services and their respective features and functionality at any time, without notice or warning and without liability.
Modification

. HealthTap reserves the right to display the HealthTap brand, and any image, name, brand or label which HealthTap has rights to, on any and all of the Licensed Services. HealthTap reserves all rights not expressly granted to the Practice in this Agreement.

. HealthTap may, in its sole discretion, suspend the Practice’s access to the Licensed Services for any of the following reasons (i) to prevent damages to, or degradation of, the Licensed Services; (ii) to comply with any law, regulation, court order, or other governmental request; (iii) if the Practice breaches any provision set forth in this Agreement, including, without limitation, this Section 1 or Section 2 hereof; (iv) to otherwise protect HealthTap from potential legal liability; and/or (v) in the event the License Fee (as such term is defined in Section 3(a) hereof) has not been collected in advance and remains unpaid for more than forty-five (45) or more days from the date such fee is due to HealthTap from the Practice.
Suspension of Access

. The Practice warrants that it will cause any and all of its Licensed Users to comply with the terms of this Agreement and shall be responsible for all use of the Licensed Services by its Licensed Users.

REPRESENTATIONS, WARRANTIES AND COVENANTS OF THE PRACTICE
The Practice hereby represents, warrants and covenants to HealthTap, as of the Effective Date and during the Term, that the Practice and each physician associated with the Practice:

Shall: (i) use the Licensed Services for care or informational Remote Medical Consultations only as permitted by applicable federal and/or state law, rules and regulations; (ii) be solely responsible for determining how and when, a patient-physician relationship must be established in order to provide Remote Medical Consultations using the Licensed Services; (iii) satisfy the requirements for establishing a patient-physician relationship as required by applicable federal and/or state law, rules and regulations, in order to provide Remote Medical Consultations using the Licensed Services; and (iv) determine at all times when to use, and when not to use, the Licensed Services.

Will provide immediate written notice to HealthTap to HealthTap’s then current notice information of any of the following: (i) the commencement or resolution of any investigation or proceeding by any licensing authority, or other governmental body or agency;

(ii) any malpractice action which is commenced, adjudicated or settled; (iii) the termination, suspension, revocation or non-renewal of privileges, association, or employment at any hospital or health care facility; (iv) any change in status of their DEA or state medical licenses or their Board certification with the American Board of Medical Specialties; or (v) any conviction or plea of guilty or nolo contendere to a felony in a court of competent jurisdiction;

Acknowledges and agrees that, upon termination of this Agreement, HealthTap shall offer the Practice’s patients the opportunity to participate in the HealthTap Prime product without further participation of the Practice; and

THE OLD WAY
Traditional disaster response teams can take hours to respond.
First responders incur a tremendous amount of personal health and safety risk.
Transporting and deploying personnel on the ground can be extremely costly.
HealthTap can virtually deploy thousands of doctors instantly
Doctor can safely advise and inform your entire population quickly, cost-effectively, and safely
Case study:
Overview of deployment
Flex (NASDAQ: FLEX) is a leading sketch-to-scale™ solutions company that designs and builds
intelligent products for a connected world, with more than 200,000 employees (400,000 with dependents)
across 40 countries.
In December 2015, approximately five thousand Flex employees in Chennai were affected by
flooding from heavy rainfall generated by the annual northeast monsoon. More than 500 people
were killed and over 1.8 million people were displaced. With estimates of damages and losses
ranging from $7 to 15 billion, the floods were among the costliest natural disasters of the year.
Flex looked to HealthTap SOS to provide assistance to its employees in the region. HealthTap SOS
provided employees with advice on how to react to the situation and how to help others, and offered
tips on how to mitigate the spread of bacteria such as leptospira, which is found in pools of
contaminated water.
Unprecedented results
HealthTap SOS for Flex has already demonstrated utilization rates that are unprecedented in industry:
3 hours
From news to deployment
employees received answers, tips, and consults during the disaster
of ongoing support during the entirety of the disaster
“We needed to quickly provide thousands of our employees with accessible, easy-to-use information and
virtual care, and that’s exactly what HealthTap delivered. Access to physical resources was extremely
limited, and through HealthTap’s proprietary technology and deep domain expertise, we were able to
help our employees and their loved ones during an extremely difficult situation.”
State-of-the-art technology
The world’s first Healthcare Operating System
Power your organization with HOPES — the fully integrated, engaging and smart Health Operating System, providing query-to-cure virtual care to your patients, anytime, anywhere.
Publish Virtual Office Hours for each doctor to allow patients to easily book virtual consult appointments.
Library

Enable convenient access to doctor care by live HD video/voice/text chat or secure messaging
Easily advise, prescribe, diagnose, treat, refer, order and interpret lab tests, and offer second opinions
Services
Send prescriptions automatically to any U.S. retail or mail order pharmacy or a pharmacy network of your choice
Order and interpret results from labs at any Quest Diagnostics facility in the U.S. or a lab of your choice
Establish a Virtual Practice (ViP) for your doctors to enhance visibility, reputation, and accessibility
Patients can search providers by topics of expertise (‘Known fors’) or reputation (‘DocScore’)
Showcase your doctors’ reputation and expertise to hundreds of millions of patients and doctors worldwide
Replace your discharge notes with simple checklists with automated follow up and reminders that help your patients adhere to their treatment plan and feel good faster
Automate newsletters and offer personalized feeds of doctor insights’ for each of your patients to build loyalty to your practice
Payment
Complements your existing payment collection system with easy collection by credit card, Apple Pay, Google Pay, and other payment methods.
Can submit billing claims and receipts to your EMR or other billing management system
Personal Health Record
generated by explicit and implicit inputs from the patient and their connected devices and apps
Includes data from HealthTap’s proprietary Health Graph
Quickly integrates and syncs with your EMR or Practice Management system for medical records, billing claims, scheduling, and more.
Your EMR
Analytics

HealthTap provides detailed utilization reports, a zeitgeist population health insights, and data analytics tools for historical, current, and predictive analysis that detail trends and insights within the patient population. This data-centric approach enables providers to deliver optimal care at a lower cost.
Integrates with existing apps or sites so your IT ecosystem can be powered by the same underlying PHR, data, analytics, and technology services
Easily extensible so you can build custom apps for specific workflows and use cases on top of the same system

Featured provider:
Waikato District Health Board (DHB) is one of 20 district health boards in New Zealand,
employing more than 6,500 people to plan, fund and provide hospital, health and disability
services to the more than 375,000 people, either directly or by funding and contracting
other providers. It includes a tertiary hospital, a secondary hospital, three rural
hospitals and it also offers a wide range of community-based and health promotion services.
The Waikato DHB provides tertiary services (such as neurosurgery and other highly complex
surgery, specialised medical procedures and specialist trauma services) to a Midland health
region population of more than 850,000.
HealthTap partnered with Waikato District Health
Board (DHB) in New Zealand to launch “The Virtual District Health Board powered by HealthTap”
to virtualize healthcare by providing immediate access to a top-quality New Zealand-based
health service. The groundbreaking partnership is creating fundamental improvements in
clinical service delivery to the population through enhanced care and service, advanced
health education, seamless medical communications, and advanced clinical engagement tools.
“We want citizen-centric healthcare that is at the patient’s convenience
and delivered in their community, closer to home. Every citizen at some
point will become a patient, and they should have agency, control, and a
voice in the way care is delivered and received.
Access is vital. We believe high-quality care, provided conveniently and cost-effectively,
is our citizens’ fundamental human right, removing boundaries and inequalities. With our
new virtual health service, powered by HealthTap's HOPESTM, we can deliver the highest-quality
care at a lower cost. This is not incremental software implementation. We are embarking on a
clinical service revolution that will provide ubiquitous access to our citizens and empower
our doctors and other health professionals through global collaboration, greater convenience,
and increased flexibility. With the Waikato-HealthTap partnership, more than one million
New Zealand citizens will be able to live happier and healthier lives.”
— Dr. Nigel Murray, CEO of Waikato District Health Board
Unprecedented scale and speed
HealthTap and Waikato launched an integrated solution at a speed that was greatly enabled by the interoperability and agility of HOPES:
1 million
Lives covered
4 weeks

Flex (NASDAQ: FLEX) is a leading sketch-to-scale™ solutions company that designs and builds intelligent products for a connected world,

with more than 200,000 employees (400,000 with dependents) across 40 countries. HealthTap Compass replaces the main interface employees used to access their health benefits, with single-sign-on integration to their health insurance third party administrators, health savings account, dental/vision plans, and more.
Highly successful engagement engine

Over the last six years, HealthTap has optimized and validated how to engage more than a quarter billion consumers at scale. HealthTap brought this experience to Flex, where both companies jointly executed on an engagement strategy which included: personalized email campaigns, push notification, fliers, roadshow, raffles and competitions, mailers, office posters, cafeteria table cards, desktop wallpapers, local employee ambassadors, and more.

trans-unit.resname: GUIDELINES To ask a great HealthTap question, use these helpful guidelines
trans-unit.source: GUIDELINES To ask a great HealthTap question, use these helpful guidelines

trans-unit.resname:
Sweat the details... at least a little. Hide examples
Good: I had an itchy dry rash on the inside of my elbows for 3 weeks. What could be the causes?
Not so good: Why do I have a rash?
trans-unit.source:
Sweat the details... at least a little. Hide examples
Good: I had an itchy dry rash on the inside of my elbows for 3 weeks. What could be the causes?
Not so good: Why do I have a rash?

trans-unit.resname:
Make it long enough to be helpful to others. Millions of people all over the world may read your question and its answers. Show examples
Good: What could cause low back pain after doing chores in the house – I’ve never had a back injury?
Not so good: Why back pain?
trans-unit.source:
Make it long enough to be helpful to others. Millions of people all over the world may read your question and its answers. Show examples
Good: What could cause low back pain after doing chores in the house – I’ve never had a back injury?
Not so good: Why back pain?

trans-unit.resname:
Include sex/gender, when relevant. Show examples
Sex/Gender helpful: What could cause a lump, the size of a quarter, just under a man’s breast.
Sex/Gender not necessary: What could cause a rubbery bump, the size of a jelly bean, under the skin on the back of my hand?
trans-unit.source:
Include sex/gender, when relevant. Show examples
Sex/Gender helpful: What could cause a lump, the size of a quarter, just under a man’s breast.
Sex/Gender not necessary: What could cause a rubbery bump, the size of a jelly bean, under the skin on the back of my hand?

trans-unit.resname:
Include an approximate age. Show examples
Different ages will lead to different answers: For the past 2 days my 15 year old son has had a fever and been limping as if his leg hurts. What are some things that could cause this?
Why has my 3 year old been experiencing some fever and limping as if his leg hurts for the past 2 days?
trans-unit.source:
Include an approximate age. Show examples
Different ages will lead to different answers: For the past 2 days my 15 year old son has had a fever and been limping as if his leg hurts. What are some things that could cause this?
Why has my 3 year old been experiencing some fever and limping as if his leg hurts for the past 2 days?

trans-unit.resname:
Include weight, height and dosage units, where relevant. Show examples
Good: My son is 3 years old, weights 27 pounds, and is 34 inches tall. Is his size OK for his age?
Not so good: My son is 3, weighs 27, and has a height of 34. Is he OK for his age?
trans-unit.source:
Include weight, height and dosage units, where relevant. Show examples
Good: My son is 3 years old, weights 27 pounds, and is 34 inches tall. Is his size OK for his age?
Not so good: My son is 3, weighs 27, and has a height of 34. Is he OK for his age?

trans-unit.resname:
Please use both brand and generic names for medications, especially if you’re outside of the U.S. or asking about an uncommon medication. Show examples
Good: My son is 5 years old, 55lbs, and has a fever. He took 5ml of Tylenol (acetaminophen120mg/5ml), but his fever persists. Can children of this weight and age take a bigger dose of Tylenol?
Not so good: My son is 5, weighs 55, and has a fever. Tried Tylenol but fever persists. Take more Tylenol?
trans-unit.source:
Please use both brand and generic names for medications, especially if you’re outside of the U.S. or asking about an uncommon medication. Show examples
Good: My son is 5 years old, 55lbs, and has a fever. He took 5ml of Tylenol (acetaminophen120mg/5ml), but his fever persists. Can children of this weight and age take a bigger dose of Tylenol?
Not so good: My son is 5, weighs 55, and has a fever. Tried Tylenol but fever persists. Take more Tylenol?

trans-unit.resname:
Try to avoid questions that set doctors up for a YES or NO answer. Show examples
Good: How do antibiotics work in young, school-aged children?
Not so good: Do antibiotics work in children?
trans-unit.source:
Try to avoid questions that set doctors up for a YES or NO answer. Show examples
Good: How do antibiotics work in young, school-aged children?
Not so good: Do antibiotics work in children?

trans-unit.resname:
Try to leave opinions out. Show examples
Good: Why are some people against vaccines, when vaccines are used to prevent bad diseases?
Not so good: Are those anti-vaccine folks completely clueless or just in denial?
trans-unit.source:
Try to leave opinions out. Show examples
Good: Why are some people against vaccines, when vaccines are used to prevent bad diseases?
Not so good: Are those anti-vaccine folks completely clueless or just in denial?

trans-unit.resname:
The clearer, the better. Use good grammar, avoid profanities and stay away from slang. Show examples
Good: I was doing arm curls and felt a burning pain in my biceps. Could I have torn a muscle?
Not so good: Doing curls, felt something and arm hurts?
trans-unit.source:
The clearer, the better. Use good grammar, avoid profanities and stay away from slang. Show examples
Good: I was doing arm curls and felt a burning pain in my biceps. Could I have torn a muscle?
Not so good: Doing curls, felt something and arm hurts?

trans-unit.resname:
Don’t assume personal historical knowledge. HealthTap doctors often will not have seen your previous questions. Show examples
Good: My 2 year old son got ear tubes two months and now has a fever and pus coming from his right ear. Is this common?
Not so good: And it’s been going on for two days, and pus is coming out too?
trans-unit.source:
Don’t assume personal historical knowledge. HealthTap doctors often will not have seen your previous questions. Show examples
Good: My 2 year old son got ear tubes two months and now has a fever and pus coming from his right ear. Is this common?
Not so good: And it’s been going on for two days, and pus is coming out too?

trans-unit.resname:
To maintain privacy, leave your name and the names of others out (unless that “other” is a celebrity who has publicly talked about an issue). Show examples
Good: I just heard the actor Michael J. Fox talk about his Parkinson’s disease. Are there any new, good treatments that have come out in the last 3 years?
Not so good: Hello doctor. My name is John Doe, and I am wondering if there are any good treatments for Parkinson’s disease.
trans-unit.source:
To maintain privacy, leave your name and the names of others out (unless that “other” is a celebrity who has publicly talked about an issue). Show examples
Good: I just heard the actor Michael J. Fox talk about his Parkinson’s disease. Are there any new, good treatments that have come out in the last 3 years?
Not so good: Hello doctor. My name is John Doe, and I am wondering if there are any good treatments for Parkinson’s disease.

trans-unit.resname:
Avoid using too many abbreviations because these can get downright confusing. Show examples
Good: How do you know if you are pregnant, if you never have regular periods?
Not so good: How do u no ur prego if u never have reg periods?
trans-unit.source:
Avoid using too many abbreviations because these can get downright confusing. Show examples

trans-unit.resname:
Ask in English. This is the language commonly used by doctors on HealthTap. Show examples
Good: I pruned some trees last weekend and my arm has been hurting for 2 days. Could this be the cause?
Not so good: Porque mi brazo me duele mucho esta semana?

Dear [Patient name],

trans-unit.resname:
I’m happy to share with you that I've found a great new simple and free way to help you live a healthier happier life, and for us to stay connected between visits. Very soon, you will start receiving from me a weekly HealthTap newsletter filled with great pearls of wisdom and beautiful pictures that can help you keep healthy living top of mind.

The newsletter will come from my Virtual Practice on HealthTap - a free web and mobile service that allows you to ask health questions, receive daily health tips, and benefit from the world’s most trustworthy and useful health information written by yours truly and some of the best doctors in the US.

trans-unit.resname:
These terms (the “Free Trial Terms”) govern the offer (the “Prime Free Trial Offer”) by HealthTap to New Qualified Users to access to the HealthTap Prime Service upon signing up and submitting payment information for a new HealthTap Prime account (the “Free Trial Period”). By submitting your payment details, you accept the Prime Free-Trial Offer and: (i) consent to our use of your payment information in accordance with our Payment Details Terms, and (ii) acknowledge and agree to the HealthTap Terms of Use and these Free Trial Terms. If you decide that you do not want to become a paying user of HealthTap Prime under the standard HealthTap Prime Terms in effect at the end of the Free Trial Period, you must cancel your HealthTap Prime Subscription (in the Billing Settings section of your HealthTap account Settings) before the end of the Free Trial Period. Subscription fees are not prorated; cancellations after the termination of the Free Trial Period will remain active through the end of the trial length period during which the account is canceled. You may only use this Free Trial Offer once. HealthTap reserves the right, in its absolute discretion, to determine individual eligibility for this Prime Free-Trial Offer and to withdraw or to modify this Prime Trial Offer and/or the Free Trial Terms at any time, without prior notice and with no liability.

Payment Details Terms: When you sign up for a trial or any of our Premium Services, or make other purchases through the Apps, your credit card information and other financial data needed to process your payment are collected and stored by third party payment processors, and we may collect some limited information, such as your postal code and transaction history details. The use of your data by any such third party payment processors is subject to their privacy policies. These third parties generally provide us with some limited information (such as a unique token that enables you to make additional purchases using the information they’ve stored, and your card’s type, expiration date, and last four digits).

See the HealthTap Terms of Use for the definitions of “HealthTap,” “HealthTap Prime,” “Apps,” and “Premium Services.” “New Qualified Users” means new HealthTap Prime customers without a prior primary or sub-account or trial account on HealthTap Prime.

Please note that the following prescriptions are not currently available via HealthTap Prime: narcotics or DEA controlled substances (Schedule I, II, III, IV), psychiatric or lifestyle medications (such as diet or erectile dysfunction drugs), or medications restricted by individual states.
trans-unit.source:

trans-unit.resname:
RateRx is a new, independent resource for doctors and patients alike, that presents ratings of medication effectiveness as reported by thousands of U.S.-licensed doctors in clinical practice of more than 137 specialties. RateRx represents the first comprehensive assessment of what experienced clinicians in each specialty actually use in the care of patients with specific conditions. Unlike other studies, which may report on the clinical effectiveness of treatments under controlled circumstances, RateRx calls on the deep, long-term, real-world experience of top doctors to reveal which treatments doctors have learned actually work with patients.

Doctors were asked to rate the clinical effectiveness of a drug for treating a condition on a scale of 1 to 5 stars. Contributing doctors gave ratings to medications for their use with specific indications based on their knowledge and were instructed to provide input based only on clinical experience using the drug for that indication. We summarized the combined ratings for each treatment into an aggregate rating reflecting doctors’ collective experiences. The profiles of all doctors who provided ratings are visible to users, who can review details of the doctors’ training and experiences, including their specialties and board certifications.

Participation in this study was open to all U.S.-licensed doctors in good standing. All 66,000 doctors in HealthTap’s Medical Expert Network were encouraged to participate. In addition, HealthTap invited more than 500,000 U.S. licensed doctors in our extended network to participate. Doctors are able to enter effectiveness ratings for medications that treat any condition, and can enter and add ratings for any new medication treatments not already included.

RateRx results display each treatment for an indication in an ordered rank based on average ratings, from highest rated to lowest. When differences between the ratings of alternative treatments are deemed meaningful based on the amount of data presented.

To ensure unbiased doctor evaluations, doctors do not see their colleagues’ existing contributions until after they have entered their own rating. Recommendations cannot be changed once submitted, but after ratings are submitted, doctors can view the ratings of other doctors and comment on these. Both patients and doctors can learn from the RateRx ratings system. Patients benefit from the collective wisdom shared by these doctors, enabling them to see how different treatments for the same conditions are rated and reviewed. Doctors benefit from their colleagues’ ratings and comments, and are able to interpret them by referring to the contributing doctors’ practice profiles (which show their education and experience, their specialty training, years in practice, DocScore, and their “Known for” topics).

Comments, which are optional, are often used by doctors to qualify or explain ratings, or to share details of how medications are used for each indication. Comments are available to read and review, do not change the numeric value of the rating. Ratings are based on generic drug names, but brand names are presented to permit doctors to rate specific drugs. Brand names are shown for every generic medication name presented. This study does not differentiate ratings between different brand names for the same medication. The most common medication treatments for each condition are listed for ratings, but doctors are encouraged to add treatments for any indication, ensuring the inclusion of new or novel treatments for each condition. Doctors were instructed to add medications not previously on the list of standard treatment only if they had experience using the medication to treat the condition at issue and found these medication effective in the treatment of that condition.

Okay

trans-unit.resname: Our mission is to measurably prolong the life expectancy of humankind and help everyone Feel Good by providing immediate access to top medical experts and their trusted health advice anytime, anywhere.
trans-unit.source: Our mission is to measurably prolong the life expectancy of humankind and help everyone Feel Good by providing immediate access to top medical experts and their trusted health advice anytime, anywhere.

trans-unit.resname:
HealthTap has reinvented the way people all over the world take care of their health and well-being, connecting millions everywhere with the most trusted health information and doctors.

Why choose us
With over 2.6 billion answers served from more than 100 specialties, our experts are able to provide the best medical advice for your question. We have the largest doctor network to provide answers, personalized advice, and care for any question.

About our doctors
To become a member of HealthTap’s Medical Expert Network, doctors have to be U.S. board certified, pass a stringent qualification process, and undergo training on how to give helpful advice using our technology platform. We closely monitor user feedback to ensure that our doctors are providing the highest possible care.

Do whatever \ you can to make the patient feel comfortable. Practice now by \ typing a caring chat message below and pressing enter to send.

Do whatever \ you can to make the patient feel comfortable. Practice now by \ typing a caring chat message below and pressing enter to send.

trans-unit.resname: All consults will start with a chat message from the patient \ explaining the reason for the consult.
trans-unit.source: All consults will start with a chat message from the patient \ explaining the reason for the consult.

trans-unit.resname: I have a skin rash and I’m concerned it might be from \ food allergies.
trans-unit.source: I have a skin rash and I’m concerned it might be from \ food allergies.

trans-unit.resname: One of the exciting things about virtual consults is that \ patients can share photos, test results, or other \ documents with you.
trans-unit.source: One of the exciting things about virtual consults is that \ patients can share photos, test results, or other \ documents with you.

trans-unit.resname: And communication is a two-way street! During your consult, \ you can attach files (like pamphlets or educational materials)\ to help your patient understand your comments or advice.
trans-unit.source: And communication is a two-way street! During your consult, \ you can attach files (like pamphlets or educational materials)\ to help your patient understand your comments or advice.

trans-unit.resname: In addition to text consults, patients can choose to have video \ consults. Next we will check if your video is working correctly.
trans-unit.source: In addition to text consults, patients can choose to have video \ consults. Next we will check if your video is working correctly.

trans-unit.resname: Great! The Patient Chart will be very helpful to you, as you \ can see your patient’s medical history, read questions the patient \ has asked, and review consult notes from other HealthTap doctors.
trans-unit.source: Great! The Patient Chart will be very helpful to you, as you \ can see your patient’s medical history, read questions the patient \ has asked, and review consult notes from other HealthTap doctors.

trans-unit.resname: Click on the different sections below to explore the patient chart. \ When ready, press the continue button.
trans-unit.source: Click on the different sections below to explore the patient chart. \ When ready, press the continue button.

trans-unit.resname: Tip: Always explain to the patient when you divert your eyes from \ the camera to read or type notes. Make them feel comfortable by \ explaining that this is normal and expected.
trans-unit.source: Tip: Always explain to the patient when you divert your eyes from \ the camera to read or type notes. Make them feel comfortable by \ explaining that this is normal and expected.

trans-unit.resname: Intro consults are a first visit with a prospective patient \ who is not yet accepted into your practice. Even if you choose not \ to accept a patient into your practice, you can still offer advice \ and suggest appropriate follow-up care during the intro consult.
trans-unit.source: Intro consults are a first visit with a prospective patient \ who is not yet accepted into your practice. Even if you choose not \ to accept a patient into your practice, you can still offer advice \ and suggest appropriate follow-up care during the intro consult.

trans-unit.resname: Enter Introductory Consult Notes for the patient. When done, press the \ continue button.
trans-unit.source: Enter Introductory Consult Notes for the patient. When done, press the \ continue button.

trans-unit.resname: At any time during the intro consult, you may select the checkmark \ below the intro consult notes section to accept the patient \ into your virtual practice. This is a great way to extend your \ reach and grow your practice!
trans-unit.source: At any time during the intro consult, you may select the checkmark \ below the intro consult notes section to accept the patient \ into your virtual practice. This is a great way to extend your \ reach and grow your practice!

trans-unit.resname: When you accept a person as a patient, the full SOAP Note \ displays. To complete your consult, you'll need to complete and submit \ your summary or SOAP Note. To help you fully understand this form, let's \ take a tour through each of the sections.
trans-unit.source: When you accept a person as a patient, the full SOAP Note \ displays. To complete your consult, you'll need to complete and submit \ your summary or SOAP Note. To help you fully understand this form, let's \ take a tour through each of the sections.

trans-unit.resname: When you accept a person as a patient, the full SOAP Note \ displays. To complete your consult, \ you'll need to complete and submit your summary or SOAP Note. To \ help you fully understand this form, let's take a tour through each \ of the sections.
trans-unit.source: When you accept a person as a patient, the full SOAP Note \ displays. To complete your consult, \ you'll need to complete and submit your summary or SOAP Note. To \ help you fully understand this form, let's take a tour through each \ of the sections.

trans-unit.resname: When you accept a person as a patient, the full SOAP Note \ displays. To complete your consult and get paid for the visit, \ you'll need to complete and submit your summary or SOAP Note. To \ help you fully understand this form, let's take a tour through each \ of the sections.
trans-unit.source: When you accept a person as a patient, the full SOAP Note \ displays. To complete your consult and get paid for the visit, \ you'll need to complete and submit your summary or SOAP Note. To \ help you fully understand this form, let's take a tour through each \ of the sections.

trans-unit.resname: Keep it up! You are more than half way done. Subjective, Objective, \ and Assessment sections are where you can enter text freely about \ the visit.
trans-unit.source: Keep it up! You are more than half way done. Subjective, Objective, \ and Assessment sections are where you can enter text freely about \ the visit.

trans-unit.resname: The Plan section has several structured elements to help your \ patient follow through with your recommendations.
trans-unit.source: The Plan section has several structured elements to help your \ patient follow through with your recommendations.

trans-unit.resname: This is where you can really help your patient! You’ll notice that \ you can add as many recommended actionable steps or follow-up \ care instructions. Make sure you have at least one. You can \ also turn any recommendation into a helpful regular reminder with just \ a few clicks.
trans-unit.source: This is where you can really help your patient! You’ll notice that \ you can add as many recommended actionable steps or follow-up \ care instructions. Make sure you have at least one. You can \ also turn any recommendation into a helpful regular reminder with just \ a few clicks.

trans-unit.resname: Go ahead and give it a try. For example, recommend a 30-minute walk, \ once a day, for a month.
trans-unit.source: Go ahead and give it a try. For example, recommend a 30-minute walk, \ once a day, for a month.

trans-unit.resname: One of the things patients really appreciate is that you can prescribe \ medications that are sent directly to a patient's indicated pharmacy. \ For patients located outside of the U.S, you can recommend medications.
trans-unit.source: One of the things patients really appreciate is that you can prescribe \ medications that are sent directly to a patient's indicated pharmacy. \ For patients located outside of the U.S, you can recommend medications.

trans-unit.resname: Another new functionality, that delights and saves patients \ time is the ability for you to order lab tests virtually. The \ lab order will be sent to the Quest Service Center the patient \ chooses. Once the patient has been tested you will be sent the \ results for review.
trans-unit.source: Another new functionality, that delights and saves patients \ time is the ability for you to order lab tests virtually. The \ lab order will be sent to the Quest Service Center the patient \ chooses. Once the patient has been tested you will be sent the \ results for review.

trans-unit.resname: Simply start typing to see the options of more than 2,000 lab \ tests you can order.
trans-unit.source: Simply start typing to see the options of more than 2,000 lab \ tests you can order.

trans-unit.resname: To suggest a follow-up appointment, include when the patient \ should schedule the appointment and, optionally, what the purpose of the follow-up is. \ The patient will receive a link to easily schedule the appointment.
trans-unit.source: To suggest a follow-up appointment, include when the patient \ should schedule the appointment and, optionally, what the purpose of the follow-up is. \ The patient will receive a link to easily schedule the appointment.

trans-unit.resname: You can refer your patients to any doctor within or outside \ the HealthTap network. Alternatively, refer a specialty and we’ll \ provide a list of specialists for your patient to choose from.
trans-unit.source: You can refer your patients to any doctor within or outside \ the HealthTap network. Alternatively, refer a specialty and we’ll \ provide a list of specialists for your patient to choose from.

trans-unit.resname: Tip: We recommend you refer patients to doctors who participate in \ HealthTap Concierge so your patients can get immediate follow-up care. \ Concierge doctors will be indicated with a small green dot and labeled \ "Available for Virtual Consults".
trans-unit.source: Tip: We recommend you refer patients to doctors who participate in \ HealthTap Concierge so your patients can get immediate follow-up care. \ Concierge doctors will be indicated with a small green dot and labeled \ "Available for Virtual Consults".

trans-unit.resname: Checklists are recommended actions that help your patient achieve \ a health goal or feel better. Patients receive timely reminders for each \ to-do on the list. You can browse through a wealth of checklists that \ doctors on HealthTap have created by topic and choose the best one for \ your patient.
trans-unit.source: Checklists are recommended actions that help your patient achieve \ a health goal or feel better. Patients receive timely reminders for each \ to-do on the list. You can browse through a wealth of checklists that \ doctors on HealthTap have created by topic and choose the best one for \ your patient.

trans-unit.resname: Patients see the SOAP notes you enter. If you wish to add notes only \ visible to doctors, please include them in the Additional Chart \ Notes section.
trans-unit.source: Patients see the SOAP notes you enter. If you wish to add notes only \ visible to doctors, please include them in the Additional Chart \ Notes section.

trans-unit.resname: In the unlikely event that the consult cannot be completed successfully \ or the patient behaves inappropriately, please flag the consult. \ This notifies us and ends the consult. Always inform your patient before you press \ the flag, as it will end the consult. Go ahead, try it now.
trans-unit.source: In the unlikely event that the consult cannot be completed successfully \ or the patient behaves inappropriately, please flag the consult. \ This notifies us and ends the consult. Always inform your patient before you press \ the flag, as it will end the consult. Go ahead, try it now.

trans-unit.resname: When you click the 'Send & End Consult' button, the consult will end \ and your SOAP Note will be sent to the patient and become a part of their \ Patient's Chart. You can ask your patient to end the consult on their end \ so that you can take a few minutes to finish your SOAP Note. Then click \ this button when you are done.
trans-unit.source: When you click the 'Send & End Consult' button, the consult will end \ and your SOAP Note will be sent to the patient and become a part of their \ Patient's Chart. You can ask your patient to end the consult on their end \ so that you can take a few minutes to finish your SOAP Note. Then click \ this button when you are done.

trans-unit.resname: Tip: Please remember to always start and finish every consult with a \ smile and warm greetings. When ending a consult, show patients that you \ care by asking if there's anything else you can do to help them.
trans-unit.source: Tip: Please remember to always start and finish every consult with a \ smile and warm greetings. When ending a consult, show patients that you \ care by asking if there's anything else you can do to help them.

trans-unit.resname: (Note: in an actual consult, this would trigger your \ earnings to go into your account, which gets disbursed \ monthly)
trans-unit.source: (Note: in an actual consult, this would trigger your \ earnings to go into your account, which gets disbursed \ monthly)

trans-unit.resname: Once the consult has ended, you and the patient rate each other \ on a 5-star scale. At HealthTap, we strive for the highest standards, \ and the highest levels of customer satisfaction, so it’s important to \ maintain a high star ratings to retain your HealthTap Concierge license.
trans-unit.source: Once the consult has ended, you and the patient rate each other \ on a 5-star scale. At HealthTap, we strive for the highest standards, \ and the highest levels of customer satisfaction, so it’s important to \ maintain a high star ratings to retain your HealthTap Concierge license.

trans-unit.resname: Do you see yourself? If not, click the white gear icon on the \ bottom left to check your camera settings.
trans-unit.source: Do you see yourself? If not, click the white gear icon on the \ bottom left to check your camera settings.

trans-unit.resname: Do you see yourself? If not, click the white gear icon on the \ top left to check your camera settings.
trans-unit.source: Do you see yourself? If not, click the white gear icon on the \ top left to check your camera settings.

trans-unit.resname: If you need additional support, please contact your IT \ department.
trans-unit.source: If you need additional support, please contact your IT \ department.

trans-unit.resname: If you need additional support, please email \ {email_link_tag_start}{email}{link_tag_end} or call us at {phone}.
trans-unit.source: If you need additional support, please email \ {email_link_tag_start}{email}{link_tag_end} or call us at {phone}.

trans-unit.resname: • Same day appointment reminders are sent by SMS
trans-unit.source: • Same day appointment reminders are sent by SMS

trans-unit.resname: Just like you're available when your real {clinic_slash}office is open, it's important \ that you're online and available during your designated Virtual \ Office Hours. Patients may be looking for you at these times. You do not \ have to be at your desk, simply sign in and set yourself as “available” on \ the HealthTap for Doctors mobile app. The app will ring when your \ patient calls.
trans-unit.source: Just like you're available when your real {clinic_slash}office is open, it's important \ that you're online and available during your designated Virtual \ Office Hours. Patients may be looking for you at these times. You do not \ have to be at your desk, simply sign in and set yourself as “available” on \ the HealthTap for Doctors mobile app. The app will ring when your \ patient calls.

trans-unit.resname: Tip: The HealthTap for Doctors app is available to download \ for free on any mobile device or tablet for iOS and Android. You \ can start consults on your mobile device. At any time, you can \ continue the consult on your computer by going to your logged in \ homepage.
trans-unit.source: Tip: The HealthTap for Doctors app is available to download \ for free on any mobile device or tablet for iOS and Android. You \ can start consults on your mobile device. At any time, you can \ continue the consult on your computer by going to your logged in \ homepage.

trans-unit.resname: You can set your shifts at your convenience, \ and you can change them at any time by clicking "Shift Schedule."
trans-unit.source: You can set your shifts at your convenience, \ and you can change them at any time by clicking "Shift Schedule."

trans-unit.resname: You can set your virtual office hours at your convenience, \ and you can change them at any time. You can update your virtual office \ hours, set vacation days, and choose "unavailable" times by clicking \ "Practice Hours."
trans-unit.source: You can set your virtual office hours at your convenience, \ and you can change them at any time. You can update your virtual office \ hours, set vacation days, and choose "unavailable" times by clicking \ "Practice Hours."

trans-unit.resname: In addition to live virtual consults, you will also receive Inbox \ Consults. These are paid, detailed messages from your patients that \ appear at the top of your homepage feed and must be answered within 24 \ hours. You will earn $30 when you complete patient consults and submit \ your SOAP Note.
trans-unit.source: In addition to live virtual consults, you will also receive Inbox \ Consults. These are paid, detailed messages from your patients that \ appear at the top of your homepage feed and must be answered within 24 \ hours. You will earn $30 when you complete patient consults and submit \ your SOAP Note.

trans-unit.resname: Inbox Consults are detailed questions from your patients that \ appear at the top of your homepage feed and must be answered within \ 24 hours. You can send clarification questions and have a conversation \ with the patients. To end the consult, simply submit the SOAP note.
trans-unit.source: Inbox Consults are detailed questions from your patients that \ appear at the top of your homepage feed and must be answered within \ 24 hours. You can send clarification questions and have a conversation \ with the patients. To end the consult, simply submit the SOAP note.

trans-unit.resname: Tip: Please respond to any Inbox Consults within 24 hours. \ Submit your answer as a SOAP consult note, or ask your \ patient follow-up questions by entering your question and \ clicking the “Wait for response” button.
trans-unit.source: Tip: Please respond to any Inbox Consults within 24 hours. \ Submit your answer as a SOAP consult note, or ask your \ patient follow-up questions by entering your question and \ clicking the “Wait for response” button.
